description:
THIS LOCATION!  I drive for work, so I visit many Phil'z locations.  This one is my favorite.  It's the only one without the "cool kids" vibe.  The employees at this location are friendly and warm and helpful.

That's not to say everyone at all the other locations are too cool to be nice to you, but that's often my experience and put me off Phil'z for a long time.  Now I spend shameful amounts of money there.
author: Christopher J.

description:
Cashier needs to STFU.

Other than that, beautiful spot. Great neighborhood and a playground for kids across the street. They have a little kids corner in the shop for families.

Great place to study, I spent a few hours there today.

Guy at the cashier's stand doesn't know how to control his volume or direction of projection. And the content if it all, not disturbing, just excruciatingly trite.
author: Pierre R.

description:
This is a solid neighborhood-oriented Philz outlet that serves the same large variety of yummy coffee drinks as other busier outlets. The coffee here is of the pour-over variety, which takes a while especially during busy periods, but at least you know that your order has been custom-made for yours truly.

Folks who gripe about how long it takes to get an order fulfilled are missing the point: good coffee shouldn't be rushed. If you want something fast, go to 7-Eleven or a humdrum convenience store and see for yourself how the quality suffers.
author: Vincent L.

description: Coffee was great, usual. Ordered the Ether here, 3 to be exact for some co-workers.  This review is mainly for the baristas that constantly talked loudly to each other and ignored me when I had a question. I also received the wrong drinks as I explicitly asked for iced drinks not hot. When I asked if they could change it to ice, they made a remark that I was never told them that and that I asked for hot. The employees need an attitude change here.
author: Jenny Z.

description: Okay what the heck... Philz does not take cash. I won't be back just for this reason. There are other great (better and more inclusive) places to get a good cup of coffee. Not taking cash automatically excludes people who want coffee but don't have a card or phone app attached to a card. It's discriminatory. No Philz, EVERYONE DOES NOT use plastic or the cloud for every tiny purchase. Kids, especially teens, poor people, undocumented people, minimalist people, people who live paycheck to paycheck, elderly people, homeless people... basically anyone who lives a life cash ONLY. This sucks
author: Lisa E.

description:
Great place to enjoy a cup of coffee or tea and catch up on e-mails. 
The people working here are always so kind.
author: Danielle B.

description:
You need coffee?  They make it pretty good here.  They also have a few breakfast items in the bakery case.  Pick a barista and s/he will help you out!

The register is by the door, so to get in line, you need to walk down to the end of the shop.  This location has tables and seating if you want to get some work done.  There is also a restroom in the back.  Parking is limited to free street spots.  They don't have a parking lot, so I see a lot of people walk or bike here.
author: Clara C.

description:
What I like:
- their coffee. Always gives me enough caffeine to do my work 

What could be improved (only applies when I stay to do my work/hang out):
- loud music with strong bass. Not great for someone trying to focus on her work. 
- not enough chairs/tables for the amount of customers that come to do their work. So I would say there's enough seats for 20 people max. The last few times I came, there are consistently 12-16 people here working on their laptops.
author: Erica M.

description:
Very cool little location with lots of coffee options! Most are pour over which takes a little more time, but definitely worth it! They do have a "mobile order" section for those who wish to call in early and just pick up their items. In addition to an extensive and epically curated coffee selection, they have a equally long list of pastry items as well. 

Be careful with the parking situation as there are very few spots open, and there are signs that warn against double parking and parking in red zones as you will be towed..
author: Gaaron V.

description:
We were staying at an AirBnB nearby and I was so excited when I found out that a Philz coffee was only 2 blocks away. I first tried Philz about 5 years ago and was blown away by the Mint Mojito, so I vowed to return when I came back to San Francisco.

Now that Philz has expanded in this city and beyond, and I am happy to see that the integrity of their coffee has been preserved. I wanted to try something different so I selected Jacob's Wonderbar, and it did not disappoint. The barista takes your order and brews your coffee fresh from their selection of beans. You can also ask them to add cream and/or sugar.

My coffee came up pipping hot, and it was pure coffee ecstasy. It was exactly as described: flavors of dark chocolate, smoke, and nuts. 

If I had a Philz around the corner from my house, I would be there everyday. Luckily, they are opening one in San Diego that is not too far from me.
author: Karen F.

description: Delicious pour over drip coffee, great service and delicious treats! Try the vegan donuts and ask for recommendations on coffee; the baristas are more than happy to help you choose.
author: Nikki R.

description:
A great neighborhood spot for coffee. It's got a good feel to it. 

Whenever in the area, Philz is my go to spot for a morning coffee.  The staff is nice and the coffee is good and strong.  It's a place where you could catch up with neighbors and just read or work.  

On a Friday morning I saw a number of parents gearing their kids up for school with a coffee and a toast.  There's a kids reading area as well that my daughter's enjoyed as I enjoyed a very drinkable cup of coffee.  

I had a dark roast and the kindly staff asked about the sweetness and cream level.  Sweet and creamy was my choice and it was just as I envisioned.  

I really like how the temperature of the coffee is instantly drinkable since why would anyone want to burn their mouth drinking boiling coffee?  Philz gets it on coffee. 

Solid corner coffee shop.
author: Monty W.

description: The service here is friendly but too slow.  I have a 30 min lunch but it's not enough time to walk over order food and return.  I should probably use the online system.
author: Urban E.

description: This is a great local Philz coffee in the Noe Valley area. It's kind of far out from any major public transit stops or big destinations, so it's less crowded and not as much of a wait compared to say, Philz Castro or any of the downtown ones. There's still quite a few people who come to hang out and work, though I've never had a problem finding seating. Same great flavor Philz roasts - my favs are Jacob's Wonderbar or Philtered Soul. On more than one time, I did get a weakly brewed batch that wasn't per usual Philz potency so knocking off one for the inconsistency.
author: Truc N.

description:
Introduced to the mint iced mojito coffee. So happy I was. It is so good! The minty fresh flavor brewed fresh once order was definitely an eye opening event. 

We don't have Philz in Vegas but I had been told about this coffee place in California a few times. I am happy I finally got to try it. Next time I'm gonna get the Tesora. The need to explore the coffee world is now upon me :)
author: Corabelle G.

description:
I love Philz but this 1 star review is just for this location. They are SOOOO incredibly slow. I have given them the benefit of the doubt by coming at times when they were busy and not - yet somehow regardless of how many people are in there, it takes them close to 20 minutes to toast a bagel and put some cream cheese on it. SMH. They have also messed up my food order multiple times which I let go and don't bother getting it fixed bc they'll probably take too long. 

Honestly go down a block to 24th and diamond and eat at diamond cafe. Their food is excellent and comes out super fast. 

FYI - Philz on order ahead app doesn't have all their food options listed.
author: Lisa D.

description:
When we went to this place we asked if they made certain beverages similar to Starbucks. The answer we received was clear "Everything Starbucks is we are not."

They were telling the complete truth. This is the best coffee place and the best coffee I have ever tasted in my life. They make their coffee strong if you want to strong and boy was it what's the name we had name today

We both ordered the "mocha Tesora" and within 10 minutes I was wide awake for the rest of the day.

Great taste and great service and wonderful people. There may be a few minute wait but it kills Starbucks in every way.
author: Paul W.

description:
This is our nearest Philz. I've given them a higher rating before, but am re-reviewing as I'm getting frustrated with this store in particular. They struggle to do anything beyond a walk-in coffee order with any efficiency. Order Ahead orders are usually at least five minutes late, so this is not the sort of place you can order from in a rush and be sure you'll get your coffee for on-the-go. Good often takes a remarkably long time, and they no longer seem to call out when a food order is done, or check whether you're eating in or taking away, so sometimes you will return to the counter after fifteen minutes to find three bagels wrapped up and you have to ask them which is which. 

I'd now rather go somewhere else on 24th or in the Castro, unless this place is really quiet.
author: Dominique G.

description: Even though I'm not a coffee expert, I really enjoyed their mojito! It's a cup filled with magic, and every time I order it, I try to forget how many calories that drink has  Highly recommend to anyone who hasn't tried it yet!
author: Natasha R.

description:
Finally went to philz coffee! I've seen so many people walking around with these coffee cups and have been dying to try it. When I went I got a mint mojito because those seem to be the most popular drink, and it wasn't as great as I hoped, but still pretty good. I asked to get it sweeter and it didn't really help much, so next time I'll just have to ask for it extra extra sweet. 

I for sure want to come back and try other drinks on the menu! Really cute low key place for a chain. It seems like it's just the neighborhood coffee shop, cute for kids because they can color and play with the toys.
author: Hayley D.

description: This was the best coffee I've had in a while. I ordered the Philtered Soul and had it with a little cream and it was awesome. The service was great and the people were extremely friendly. Thanks for making us out-of-towners feel welcome!
author: Jerry V.

description:
I hadn't been to philz in quite some time and I was happy to see that it hasn't changed a bit! The service was great and I love how they get it right with the sugar and cream if that's your thing. 

Also, the coffee is great but you should try the Mint tea too. Super fresh mint and spices. So nice!!! Philz is the best!!
author: Jenedine E.

description: I went to Philz with my wife on Saturday and enjoyed a delicious coffee made by Michelle. The mint mojito and cinnamon iced coffee were made exactly how we requested them. The space was clean and welcoming. We will be back soon!
author: Molly S.

description:
Love the coffee.

It would be nice if the staff at least acknowledged the customers. Every time I stop by to buy a bag of beans it's like the staff has been told to never look up or be aware of what is happening in the store.
author: Margaret I.

description: I wish they would have warned me that my order was gonna take 15 minutes. Walked in with two kids and there was no line. We waited for-ever for the drinks. Kids did their best to be patient... usually a better experience at mission location.
author: Ryan G.

description: Yummy! I love good coffee! I like sweeter drinks, and my order (2 days in a row) was perfect. If you like quality but sweet coffee, try the Dancing Water with cream and the sweet level of sugar.
author: Casey L.

description:
I love that this coffee shop stays open for a bit longer than most coffee shops in the residential areas. 

Street parking is usually not an issue here. 

They have a corner for kids to play inside which is pretty unique. They are very dog friendly; they have a treat jar for dogs. 

I love the staff here. 

Highly recommend it!
author: Hiral P.

description: This is my favorite coffee in the city. This part of town has great setting to enjoy a nice coffee with people and the remarkable man made town of San Francisco. Competitive to  some good areas with goodness in their hearts to fulfill a days worth of work and a weekend of exciting news.
author: Kenneth Y.

description: Ordered a Mint Mojito Philz way. Ordering process, service, and coffee came out as well as every other Philz Coffee I have been to, so good job!
author: Brandon L.

description:
Philz coffee...  I mean, 5 stars, right?  Given.  Review over.

   But, like, no   Cause THIS Philz is special.  This Philz is the people who work here, and I'd give them 6 stars if I could.  It's Philz, yeah?  It's busy.  And yet, somehow, the kick-ass crew here is always on point.  Understaffed?  Line out the door?  These pros are unfazed, juggling 5 pour overs at a time, chill AF, always have a smile, and always get it right.   

   This Philz is all win, the coffee (ofc), but really the friendly, funny and all around hella rad barista staff make Philz on 24th in Noe the best one in town.

 (also, 19 times out of 20 the music is fantastic, and that means something, especially if you are hanging out for a while...)
author: Bad Y.

description: Nice little Philz that is very family friendly. Good place to get some work done (if you don't mind the slight noise from the kids' section). Iced mint mojito coffee is always my go-to and Philz never disappoints, no matter the location.
author: Katherine Z.

description:
I adore this small location of Philz, if only for the counter tops full of children's (and some adult's) drawings! the employees seem to be extra friendly at this location (maybe being in Noe Valley as opposed to the Financial District promotes this 'tude?) and I like that I can actually find stevia/splenda here (not sure I could at other Philz locations quite as easily).

The coffee is on point, as expected - but I also felt like there were more grab & go lunch options here versus the downtown locations. 

Worth hiking up and town from Twin Peaks for!
author: Vicki L.

description: Super kid friendly! Has a mat area with books and toys next to entrance. Right across the street from playground. Good drinks and kind staff. Changing table in bathroom. Firemen like to visit this joint!
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
My San Francisco trip was nearing an end and I had yet to try some genuine coffee from the city, so a trip to Philz pre-airport was a must! 

I feel like this coffee shop embodies the culture of San Francisco...smiling faces; employees who are truly happy with where they work and carry themselves in a polite, welcoming manner. Laid back atmosphere with artwork (I'm guessing local) and quirky little signage (please see my Spice Girls photo lol). 

You stand in line and wait to be called up by one of 3 baristas. You have the option of Light, Medium or Dark roast coffees, each having their own selections underneath. I went for the medium roast, Philtered Soul as chocolate was a tasting note. The name being tied to the business and chocolate had me stop myself from reading any further, I knew I had the winner. You then head right and pay for your java and hover back near your barista for pickup. 

I think this was my favorite part. After the barista called me up for my coffee. She asked me to taste it to make sure it was perfect. Which it was. I was scared it would be scalding and I might burn my tongue, but it was a heavenly cup of java at the right temperature to battle the chilly fall morning. 

I can't wait to visit SF again and try the other Philz locations!
author: Kate A.

description: Been going to this location for over a year now and have never had a bad time here. Servers are fast and friendly. Once you go here enough every server will already know your order. I don't like the taste of coffee so much so I get an iced mocha tesora Philz way (medium sweet and medium cream). Tastes like a cold chocolate milk and gives you that pick me up you need in the morning.
author: Anthony B.

description:
I realize I'm super behind in jumping on the bandwagon with this one, but the mint mojito is truly amazing. Definitely worth all the hype. 

Tucked inside the residential neighborhood of Noe Valley, it's almost easy to miss this hidden gem. I've noticed that Philz Coffee has recently been opening up locations all over the Bay Area, which is wonderful now that I'm officially addicted. The baristas at this location were friendly and seemed to genuinely care that we were satisfied. My iced-drink was minty, sweet, and creamy to perfection. The tables were pretty full inside (always a good sign for the quality of a business) so we settled down on one of the benches outside - great for people watching on a warm, summer day.  

Note: they can also make a decaf mint mojito if you've already reached your daily caffeine limit.
author: Shira W.

description:
5.0 star rating 11/29/2016
Lovely Lacey I found to be five star excellent in regards to customer service,up beat personality,and just a natural enjoyment of what she does.She  never made me feel rushed when taking my order,helped me pick a great  coffee drink,and she is a real Stars in the Philz Family.Well Done to Lovely Lacey..
author: Fred S.

description:
Super friendly and helpful staff and a cozy place to work and chit chat. Not being from the area, we were kind of confused by the ordering system at Philz Coffee but it's actually super simple after the friendly worker kindly guided us through the experience! First you wait near the baristas and they'll call you up to order with them. Then you wait while they make your coffee or drink on the spot. We ordered their most popular drink Mint Mojito Iced Coffee in a large size. Small is $4 and large is $5. Took less than ten minutes for them to make it but hey, everything there is made to order and specially customized for you. :) If you're not satisfied with your drink they'll fix it for you! Then you take your drink to the front counter and pay for it and then you can finally be on your merry way with your little cup of heaven.

The interesting name of the drink did indeed live up to its hype. It may have been more on the mint side of its name and not on the 'mojito' side, but mint and coffee is a pretty good combo surprisingly! Would definitely try out a DIY variation at home. ;) The coffee is strong but not potent, and I even enjoyed it immensely being the rare coffee-drinker that I am.

Customer service is A+++. Wish they would bring this chain to LA! :(
author: Sherry C.

description:
Well, if you don't like Philz you may be a communist. I have become such a die-hard Philz fan since fellow Yelper Shawn S. introduced me to it a couple years ago. So much so, that I buy it to take home to LA. Try a variety or types, and make sure to load up on the manufacturing cream. You know, the delicious cream that you can't get anywhere else. I have been a fan of the Jacobs, Philharmonic, and darker roasts. They tend to boast more flavor, but less caffeine.

If you want a gut bomb to make your day, go for a green chili breakfast burrito to comfort you. It's a great add for your experience as you sip on your brew. You won't regret it, nor the tapatio you may  douse over the egg for some extra kick to your morning. I'm craving it, even as I type for the mushy egg and potato mix that steams from the burrito when served.

This location isn't the most accessible, but gets plenty of traffic from the stroller mafia that is Noe Valley. You'll find yourself sitting outside with a random dog, or dodging strollers if you aren't sharking for a seat. Consider ordering remotely via phone and picking your item up. It just won't be super hot. 

If anyone from Philz is reading this, just open up a place in Los Angeles already. I'll even help. Come on. Pretty please.
author: Mohib Q.

description:
It's always nice coming to this Philz because the staff here are always friendly. They make your order with a smile and that makes the experience so much more enjoyable. They never mind my larger than normal orders and gets my order right every time.

They also offer great recommendations in terms of the type of coffee you would like since there's so many selection.
author: Stephen W.

description: The best coffee in the city! Love the Noe Valley location. Staff is great and attentive. It is clean and welcoming. Can't wait to go back
author: teri r.

description: As a coffee addict you have to love Philz attention to detail. They pour over a single cup at a time so you know you are getting the freshest possible cup of coffee any time of day. Also, based on the number of fire fighters and police men and women who frequent this location you know you're getting a great cup of coffee. I highly recommend the Tantalizing Turkish (dark) with fresh mint.
author: David H.

description:
This redemotive review is long overdue.  Just couldn't stop going since they are just 2 blox away and, despite its a pricey cuppa joe, it's really good.

The customer orientation at the joint has greatly improved relative to my last hatefully described experience.

So I'm back but can and will be an asshole again if it's warranted.  :^)~
author: V T.

description:
I love this Philz location. It is located right in front of the 48 bus line that gets me home in an instant! I've been here about four times now and each time has been great.

There was one time I came here to study for my horrid organic chemistry exam and the guy who helped me was so helpful. I didn't want the typical mint mojito like I usually get, so he offered to ice any of their blends and make it almost like the mint mojito with that milk and creamy flavor. He recommended the Dancing Waters that was a medium-light roast and had a chocolatey flavor. Perfect! I liked this better than when I had a Mocha Tesora at another Philz location because I ended up with SO much chocolate at the bottom of my cup and made it so gross at the end. It really hit the spot. So usually, their mint mojitos are always great here. I've had a croissant and a bagel with cream cheese here. Eh, focus on their unique blends of coffee! They have all types of roast from dark to light. Very cool how they have so many options to suit your coffee mood for the day.

Small place, but every time I've always managed to find a seat or table. There's also a little kids corner as well.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Got the mint mojito iced coffee and philz bagel (everything bagel, oil, hummus, cucumber, tomato, salt). 

The mojito iced coffee was something I never tried but for some reason it tasted as expected: iced coffee with cream and mint flavor. But it is surprisingly really smooth and creamy. 

I originally wanted their jalapeño bagel with classic hummus and veggies but they were out of jalapeño bagel and classic hummus so I got the everything bagel and garlic hummus. The guy prepping food was super nice to compare prices for me between ordering just a bagel and adding hummus, cucumber and tomato, and philz bagel with hummus sub and adding veg. They turned out to be the same price ($5). He even let me taste the spicy hummus because I couldn't decide which flavor to get. 

There are lots of seats here - one communal table, two small 2 person tables, couches, and lotsa plugs. 

Still sitting here at the cafe and having a good experience so far!
author: Yeojin S.

description: Came here for some mint mojitos, the usual for many people. We've been to many locations but my bf had a moment....he said this is the best mint mojito he's ever had. We didn't catch our baristas name but it was a blonde hair male (1/7/17 around 11:30.) With so many locations he said we will definitely be back to this one. Customer service was great as usual!
author: Trini T.

description:
I came here to study and the Philz obsession is real and this is the closest one to me (although still 3 miles away...). Just warning everyone before you make the trek here like me: the yelp pictures make this place look deceptively bigger than it actually is!! There's like maybe 8 seats total and no I was not able to get a seat :( 

But shout-out to Philz for being the most consistent and best coffee out there. I don't normally go to this location but when my order of a mocha tesora lightly sweetened with almond milk, it came out exactly how I'm used to it and exactly the way I like it. I love how much you can customize your drink and that they don't charge $1.50 or something crazy just for some almonds in my milk. Love you Philz, forever and always
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
The staff at three Philz locations I've been to are all great, helpful and accommodating. 

But the staff here takes all the above to a higher level. A female staff( I forgot her name:( that helped us went out of her way to make sure that I was happy with my drink and that I  got what I wanted. I merely said uhh...too sweet? She's all " I'll change it!" Bam! She did! 

This place was not crowded at all when we were here. On a warm, sunny day this Philz is a cool heaven with my Cold Mint Tea and the awesome female staff is my angel!

** An Amazon Locker is inside this location**
author: Janet D.

description: The lady with the glasses and long black hair, name begins with N, she is the best barista . She knows that I am a grumpy old bastard who hates eye contact. So she serves me the Tesora with a smile but without talking to me, which I appreciate because I HATE the whole affirmation thing. The store is great here. Friendly and not overly crowded.
author: Brian P.

description:
This review is for the girl who was at the cash register today. 

Maybe I looked like a bum, rushing to meet friends at this Philz Coffee location, having worked from home earlier in the day and having foregone a shower due to early phone calls. Sure, I didn't brush my hair. And maybe I rubbernecked as I walked in, having never been to this location before. Where do I make my order? Where is the menu?

We locked eyes, so I went toward her. "Do you guys have hot chocolate?"

I don't care what she heard me say. I don't even care how she perceived me. She was simply rude. Rude. Rude, with her smirk and "WHAT?" An attitude I did not anticipate given my question. My fight or flight kicked in. It shouldn't have, and maybe I should've taken the high road, or given her a hug. Perhaps, she was having a bad day. I repeated myself in a tone of voice and volume no one would've missed. 

I just wanted a hot chocolate and to do work with friends. Now I have a second story (first was at Gracias Madre) of going into a boogie, pretentious place and having to repeat myself because an employee made a judgment about me before they heard me speak. 

BTW, this girl thought I asked if they had a driveway. Even if I had asked that, there was no need for the gross attitude. 

She didn't make my drink, so I would've tipped. However, she didn't give me a chance to as she didn't flip her ipad over to me.
author: Mariam T.

description:
Always lovin Philz Coffee! This place was pretty packed on a Sunday, but we were lucky to find parking right across the street. As always, I finished my Mint Mojito iced coffee in a jiffy! Always my go to, and an instant cup of happiness. It's pretty difficult for me to order anything else, so I decided to get a second cup to share with my friend. I ordered the highly recommended Tesora. Which had hints of butter and caramel. She made it creamy just like the Mint Mojito so of course I loved it. Just what you needed on a cold rainy day. 

The atmosphere was alright. I really enjoyed looking at the paintings on the wall. They were scenic yet abstract, just something about them was inspiring. I actually was very tempted in buying one. The music on the other hand was blasting pretty loudly that it was hard to think, so my friend and I ended up having to relocate. 

Driving out I realized that I totally forgot to pay for my last cup of coffee!! So I called them immediately to ask if they could take my credit card over the phone. They were so nice about it and said it's fine and can always just pay next time I was there. That's some genuine honest customer service right there. Makes the coffee taste even better on that regard.
author: Cindy C.

description:
Pretentious baristas with attitude. If any of you baristas are reading this, you do know you're the ones serving right? I didn't apply for a job here, you did. The least you can  do is try to act like customers are not an annoyance. 

Coffee: blah. I come here when it's convenient. There are far to many places in the city where they have good coffee.
author: Yedid G.

description:
One of the things I miss about living in SF is being able to enjoy a wonderful cup of coffee from Philz. Philz is truly a SF gem!

The last time I was here I got a warm chai and it was the best chai I've ever had. It had just the right amount of milk, spice and mint. Delicious!

My sister ordered their signature drink, mint mojito iced coffee, in large and it was HUGE! It is simply put, the perfect blend of caffeine, sugar, milk and mint. The hype is real but well deserved.
author: Laura Y.

description:
This location is located away from the heart and action of Noe Valley, way on top of 24th st. If you are coming from the BART Station, its about a 25 minute + walk cause you're going uphill. 

The one main thing that is different about this Philz is that they have a small corner dedicated for kids so they have some toys and books.
author: Daanyaal K.

description:
-Grab the bench out front to sip but watch where you set your cup! Baby buggy brigades sporting suv wheels' take a toe, knock down your joe, now you outta a whole lotta dough.
I'll be aware next time, that's what I get for having my face planted in my phone. 
Solid cuppa coffee. 
I've drank coffee here as long as Philz exsisted and then morphed other re-iterations of something coffee related here in Noe.
author: Christine T.

description: I really enjoy this Philz because of how it's in a pretty underrated corner of the city. 24th is a pretty lively street in Noe Valley, but it still is pretty residential, especially where Philz is. I never have to wait long for my coffee, and it always tastes very consistently good! I always get an iced Philtered Soul either with light cream and sugar or neither of the two. I also always manage to find parking very close by.
author: Steph V.

description: This place feels like a second home. You'll run into some one you know(if you live near the area). Even if you're not, you'll befriend some of the nicest people that work here. With a cool view of Sutro tower and situated in Noe Valley, this is easily the coolest Philz spot.
author: CJ A.

description:
Ecstatic. OMG. Philz is killing me.  Tesora is my favorite.  But this is just brilliant! A blend of all of their beans!?!  

Iced = win for the freaking 90+ weather on Friday!

$4.00 for a large iced coffee, that isn't burnt, with milk and light sugar = EPIC. 

I'm happy to have found something else besides Tesora. :D
author: Fannie S.

description: My semi local friend warned me Philz Coffee is just the Starbucks of SF.  There's nothing to it.  Well, being the tourist that I was and a yelper.. Naturally I saw that the iced mint mojito was the selling point and dragged him out to get some anyway.  I am no longer a coffee lover for health reasons, but I enjoy a good cup of coffee here and there.  The mint mojito coffee was exactly what I needed to jump start the day.  It was chill, refreshing, and delicious.  Also picture perfect.  My friend had no idea Philz Coffee had that, so he got some specialty coffee.. I may or may not have converted him into a Philz Coffee fan.  Everyone wins!
author: Carrie L.

description:
Most of the Philz coffee shop locations including the Palo Alto, San Jose and Berkeley locations are located on a busy strip.

But the newest San Francisco location is located in a residential area of family-friendly and quiet Noe Valley.

The other locations are popular hangouts for workers and hipsters. The new Philz have rich folks lounging there

Whether I'm in my suit, uniform, or casual baggy jeans and hoodie, Joe Cool feels welcome here. 

On my Facebook app, Philz's coffee offers the Ginger Snap Iced coffee. And that cool drink is what I took for $4.50. When you think of Ginger Snaps, you think of Christmas. You can actually enjoy the featured cool beverage in the springtime. This is a very refreshing drink. My drink: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cnjPZ4eI2lHTHIPlbHk9HQ?select=Uy1TPD9MwdEauFYU_51__Q#kXWzaU4lhgrouzGBCFR2SQ

Usually I'm not of much of an Iced coffee drinker, because it is a waste of freshly brewed and quality coffee. But Philz makes two outstanding iced coffee drinks: The Mint Mojito and the new Ginger Snap Iced coffee. The two iced drinks are my current favorites and the only iced coffee drinks I will drink.

As I was enjoying my drink, I was taking advantage of the shop's free wifi. Amazingly, I got a table in this small shop. 

Yes, this is also a small location. You can also enjoy your coffee in the park across the street, where you'll find 100 of Philz's cups hopefully in the garbage can.  

A very clean coffee shop with the Health Department score of: 100. Score: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cnjPZ4eI2lHTHIPlbHk9HQ?select=e_PU6Asa2kKik2gXWmzmLw#e_PU6Asa2kKik2gXWmzmLw
author: Matt G.

description:
LOVE PHILZ.

I absolutely adore Philz & their awesome coffee. My usual is the famous Iced Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. This location is not bad, hidden inside a quaint neighborhood. 

Overall love the coffee. Gotta just try it yourself to know if you're a coffee person like me.
author: Liberty C.

description:
My initial reaction when i walked in was "Just another coffee shop".  It was the pretty standard setup, with a few sctattered, cozy looking tables.  The employees were friendly, and the ood they had for sale looked about average.  But the coffee list was impressive.  

Along that vein, I decided to try out their coffee mojito.  It was iced coffee with a little sugar and a lot of fresh mint.  OH MY GOD, it was the best iced coffee I have ever had.  Hands down, second o none, I was floored.  I don't know if it was the creative mix of ingredients or the coffee, but man oh man i can't wait until i get back there for another one.

I believe there are sereval of these in San Francisco, and I hear service and quality is consistent, so go to any.  You won't be dissapinted.  It isn't a hipster mecca like Four Barrel, but if you need a little joe black, you can't go wong there.
author: Ari L.

description: I see why is everybody raving about this place. They have a lot of coffee to choose from. But not an espresso machine :) I didn't know that so even if the experience was great food wise... I was. Bit disappointed that everything is a pour over
author: Miza M.

description:
Wifi tops out at 10 Mbps.

Pleasant staff.
author: Inigo M.

description: I mean come on, it's Philz. This place is great, made to order coffee and tea every time. Always delicious! Staff is friendly and quick. Location gets busy on sat/sun mornings, so order ahead if you can!
author: Maek K.

description:
How can you ever hate this place? I mean, the service is always great and they have coffee for all tastes! If you like something cold, they have that. If you don't really like coffee and want something sweet, get a mocha tesora! Really though, just get the iced mint mojito and begin your love affair with Philz! 

What's great is if your drink isn't made to your liking, you can get it adjusted. Yes, some of the locations can be quite hipster-ish, but I've never felt weird or intimidated or out of place. A guy, who was there with his family, came back to the barista who I just placed my order with and she asked him if there was anything she needed to adjust for him. He said he was going to need another mint mojito because his dog knocked over his mom's. He was simply going to buy another, but the barista hooked it up for free. How nice! 

Yes, it can get pricey ($4.50 for a large mint mojito), but I think of it as treating my taste buds to a minty vacation!
author: Aaron Y.

description:
Their mint mojito is one of the best cups of coffee in the whole world! I highly recommend it! The experience of having your own barista is really cool and unique. 

The only reason I gave it a 4 stars is because their design and look as a company is the tackiest that I have ever seen of a coffee shop, even worse than Starbucks. If I judged Philz by their design I would never give it the time of day, but because my wife and friends told me about their mint mojito so many times...I finally walked into the hideous place and experienced their amazing coffee :)
author: Joshua C.

description: Favorite coffee in the SF.....nope, make that anywhere.  This location in Noe Valley isn't my favorite location...it's a bit cramped and I'm not usually in the area all that often.  But when in Noe, there's a Philz in my hand :)
author: Rachael S.

description:
My favorite Philz Coffee location. Everytime I come here and with different baristas making my Mint Mojito, they always come out exactly how I want it. Never disappoints. Definitely make it as sweet and creamy as I like it, so please Noe Valley, don't change! 

They raised their price on the Large size, which is now $5. Damn...I always thought $4.50 was a great price for the Large. It doesn't really phase me since I will always be drinking their coffee!!! Mint Mojito is MY ABSOLUTE FAVORITE COFFEE DRINK EVER. I remember coming to SF for a week (when I lived in SD at the time) and had it 4 times out of 5 days being in the area. Now that I live here...oh snaps! Dangerous.....Philz, is there is anyway you can have a stamp card to earn free drinks or some kind of rewards program for your loyal and frequent customers?!?!?! :) 

Anyway, this is a must-try if you're new to the SF scene or haven't tried it. The cafes are also a cool scene as well...definitely hipster, but I love it!
author: Michelle S.

description:
The very first time I came here I was pleasantly surprised to discover my favorite coffee having a shop in my neighborhood! That said, this was the only pleasant thing about this location after I saw the way the staff treated every customer who dared purchase a coffee while walking their dogs. First there was an awkward staff member greeting all dog owners outside the minute their dog even made a sound, and then this obnoxious hand written sign outside urging customers to tell the barista their order -presumably from the door if their dog was expected to bark even once while they went inside - their order, pay quickly and await their coffee outside. In my case, I paid quickly and waited at a bench outside for 10 minutes- no coffee. I inquired from the door and the staff members looked at each other as if confused before confessing they had no idea what I'd ordered. They didn't ask me how I wanted it and brought me out a black Tesora. I then told the staff member that I had asked for vanilla soy and sweetener. She replied, "No problem" very sarcastically with a plastered on smile and returned, pet my dog and went in. 
Honestly, why would anyone open a coffee shop in a neighborhood that doesn't welcome even the presence of dogs OUTSIDE?! It reflects badly on Philz I'm afraid, as well as on beautiful chill Noe Valley.
author: Kristina B.

description: Great service!!! Especially Michelle, one of the baristas.   I had just gotten my Philz Mint Mojito and was down a couple of blocks when someone knocked my coffee out of my hands (was looking at their phone).  I went back to get another one as I wanted my coffee fix.  I had already paid, but Michelle asked why I came back.  Upon realizing I had paid for a second coffee so soon she gave me a gift card for a free coffee next time I came!   Good job in putting a smile on my face!  Definitely good customer care!
author: Elaine H.

description:
Starbucks with a San Francisco twist. 
Great coffee, with different bold flavors. Lots of reviews about the mint mohito coffee. Definitely great idea as they use fresh mint leaves, but sometimes can be heavy on the mint leaves. Mint is a very strong herb with just 2-3 leaves they use about double that. Still good though. 
I got the temascura this time. Very bold mocha flavors and loved it iced. Perfect mid day jump start. 
Food wise - small sandwiches and pastries, nothing to go out of your way for but I did enjoy the cinnamon roll, very crispy outer layer with soft dough on the inside. 
Service - a little disorganized with where the beginning of the line is, but very helpful and cheery  staff.
author: Sarat V.

description: Came to this location to check it out. It is little small but I don't mind. I like all Philz coffee locations just the same. I like that this Philz Coffee location has an Amazon locker. So cool. I also like it that this location has Philz Coffee stickers. This location is in a nice neighborhood. I like it that it is right near a park. I would come back to this location anytime I am in the area.
author: Isaac H.

description: I found this to be a weird location but convenient to us at the time.. It was pretty empty at the time so the customer service was good. I got the mint mojito because that's what my friends always raved about and I just had to see what the hype was all about. It was good but sucking up little pieces of mint was kind of annoying.. I liked my drink more than my brother and fathers but unfortunately I don't remember what they got. My dads tasted like extremely strong iced coffee, which wasn't bad but not everyone's "cup of tea". Anyways, it's a nice place with different drinks and definitely recommend trying the mint mojito drink (but don't let the hype get your expectations too high cus you might end up a bit disappointed).
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
Not in love, but I am a fan!

Service: 
-AMAZING! All the employees were peppy for a Sunday afternoon and really brightened my day as well as my friends
-Delia was the barista at the time and helped all of us figure out what in the world we wanted since it was all of our first times there,

Iced Mint Mojito:
-very affordable even for a large
-Their brew seems to be a dark roast so it is kind of strong, but having the coffee "house style" sweetened up the drink a bit. 
-This coffee is delicious and a new flavor, but I am knocking Philz down one star because if your signature drink is the "Iced Mint Mojito," you should really be able to taste the mint. The mint flavor was present, but you definitely had to think about it and figure out if that was really mint that you were tasting. 
-I do really like this drink, but it's not something that I would go out of the way for

Tip:
-You order first at the bar and then pay at the cash register
-You can make an order by phone and pick it up on a little desk! Super convenient!
author: Maria V.

description: A nice change of scenery from the other Philz locations in busy hustle bustle areas. Parking is not too bad and the corner location is peaceful and calm. Grab your Philz and head over to Billy Goat Hill to enjoy the sweeping view minutes away.
author: Briget P.

description:
My favorite things about this Philz are that it's right across from the children's playground and they have a little kids area inside the shop. It's a perfect play date location as long as you go when it's not too busy. Their coffee.. I mean do I even have to say? It's delicious obvs. Also their vanilla scones and cookies served warm are amaaaazing. The baristas are also very nice, even the ones who are ~2cool~ are friendly & aim to please. 
Order at the coffee bar, not the cashier unless you wanna look like a noob :p
author: Rocio G.

description: Orderahead sucks. How does that even work for coffee? I guess the city is for sale, and so are the local businesses like Philz :'(
author: Jane D.

description: Philz coffee- just tastes good,asked you feel like there is significant individual attention to each drink. Great flavors. Just good coffee.
author: Kevin K.

description: I like Philz but am starting to experience inconsistencies in my coffee. Depending on who's making it, medium sweet could be not sweet at all or just right and 'Philz way' could be creamy or watery. The big reason for the average rating at this location is the noise and the baristas who yell and say crass things to each other as a joke. Though this may be fine in their personal lives it's not representing Philz very well and can be over the top in an already loud space.
author: Daniel R.

description:
My favorite coffee shop in San Francisco.

This location has become part of my weekend routine, sometimes for a quick stop, other times for several hours of work. In fact, it's only Monday and I'm already looking forward to my Saturday Philz stop!

I'm not a big enough coffee expert to really tell the difference between their endless list of coffees so I always pick a new one, and I've never been disappointed. Some of the most delicious coffee I've tasted.

The staff is also great and part of why I keep coming back. Super friendly, super fun. Though seating is limited, the space is very cozy and welcoming.
author: Teiki K.

description:
GIVE ME THE JITTERS!!
(4 stars)

Infamously known... easily accessible....

- FOOD/DRINKS, yummy
- PRICES, affordable
- SERVICE, average
- AMBIANCE, coffee shop

HEFFER STATUS.

MOJITO MINT ICED COFFEE - The one and only thing I like to order at this joint; one of the best iced espresso I've ever had. While very strong and it gives me a headache and jitters, I still order and enjoy it.

VANILLA BEAN SCONE - I love the taste of fresh vanilla bean. the scones here are very delicious (not stale in any way) and to have a vanilla bean scone was such a treat!!!

Will I be back? On those rare occasions!
author: Jane A.

description:
I feel like this is always a forgotten location for Philz in the city. Maybe because not too many folks come out this way on the weekends?

The guys behind the bar have been pretty on point when it comes to making my iced philtered soul drinks - especially when I say medium sweetness. Feel like they have a good gauge when it comes to that.

They've got a good selection of small bites too - the bacon burrito is legit. If you're hungry, I suggest grabbing one of those.

It's pretty sizable inside, with a good amount of seats to chill. There's no outdoor seating though.
author: Shawn B.

description:
Real neighborhood gem. Hot chocolate is amazing....Real cocoa beans here. Simply delicious.

This is a no frills store...with great coffee/chocolate. Small location with patrons sitting using Wi Fi.  Starbucks sends like a spa location compartitively. They will definitely be taking over Starbucks & Peets...once they have more locations
Cute bubbly barista. ;-).

They need to work on pastry offerings (which are currently scares and pricey) and the wierd pass the registrar to order...then pay....then go back to pick up order.  But main business of coffee....delicious.
author: Sharine d.

description:
Quaint. Cute. Neighborhood-y. 

This particular location of Philz is tucked in the corner of Noe Valley close to the Twin Peaks side and maintains a strong neighborhood allure. 

My favorites are the Philtered Soul and the Mint Mojito with extra cream (made in house!) 

The only reason I docked off a star is because it's not easy to find a seat, especially if you're here with more than one person. It's a very small location with very limited seating. And the tables at this location aren't very convenient to work or study in as well. The Philz in the Mission and SOMA are a bit larger and can accommodate more. 

Aside from that, if you're looking to pick up your morning coffee in Noe, this is your spot. 

Happy Drinking, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description: It's a rare Philz that has decent parking nearby which is why this Philz is preferable. It's got a few tables and outlets by most tables, essential for all the studying/worker bees. As a lesser known, location, I have yet to encounter a crowd so I enjoy studying here. Just wished it opened later so I could stay even longer!
author: Tina K.

description:
A crowd favorite! love this philz. It is a great place to get coffee on your way to brunch on 24th (at least that's what I always do).

Try:
the mint mojito iced coffee (as everyone recommends) 

Also try (at least once):
their "normal" coffees- they use cream here, so it makes for a bit of an unhealthy morning drink, but it is well worth it. The hazelnut tesora blend is my favorite. 

It's a little steamy in here, and I mean that in a literal way.  Between all the brewing and boiling, it gets pretty humid and hot in here! Not my favorite place to study/ sit and read, but people do it nonetheless. (some like it hot)
author: Patricia K.

description:
I come here to get a mint hot chocolate when I want to treat myself. As with other Philz spots, the wait and ordering can take a bit but it's generally well worth it.

Not the biggest fan of the pastries here but the service has always been spot on.
author: Art O.

description:
I'd come here instead of Starbies any day!

I got the mint mojito latte and it was absolutely delicious!! Reasonably priced too.  You can find street parking and might have to wait a while to get your drinks, but it's def worth the wait.
author: Audrey C.

description: pretty awesome coffee. had their mint mojito ice coffee. one of the most unique kinds of coffee i've had. it also had a slight hazelnut aroma which is really nice
author: Diana P.

description: It's hard to write about Philz without covering what's already been said a thousand times but a place this good warrants such repeated praise. Philz coffee is seriously good, seriously. Expect to spend $3-$4.5 on a cup of Joe but a cup this good is worth the extra price. If you're looking for some speciality drinks try the two big customer favorites: Mocha Tesora on cold days and the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee on the warmer ones.
author: Daniel G.

description:
When I walked in I was all: "Oh no...am I in another hipster hellhole? Are people about to be rude because I'm not following the hipster anthem? What is the hipster anthem?"

Negatory. This place was amazing. The baristas are super friendly and knowledgeable. They were really patient with introducing their method of ordering and never once made me feel like my choices in coffee were judged via the mustache grading system. 

I have a weird obsession with mint. Mint colored everything, minty cocktails, fresh mint, and especially mint in my coffee. I ordered the mint mojito iced coffee. Dude picked a fresh sprig of mint and stuck it in my coffee. My jaw dropped and I did my happy dance. 

They also carry Jamaican Blue Mountain coffee...at a whopping $120+/lb. You can also have it freshly brewed at $7-10 a cup. You know you're at the coffee haven when you see that on the menu.

Why would you go pay for overpriced shoddy coffee at an overhyped place downtown when you can have delicious take my money now worth it coffee here? Exactly. Make this your first coffee stop next time in town travelers. It's way more fetch.
author: Sujin Y.

description: My go-to coffee shop! Coming from a coffee lover who lives in the Ingleside district, yes, I do make the 10 minute drive to Noe Valley to get my Philz "fill" on the weekends. Compared to any other Philz I've been to in the Bay Area, the coffee made here is consistently good - whether I order a Jacob's Wonderbar or a hot Gingersnap (they are way better hot) - I am never disappointed. Also, I appreciate how the baristas here are always friendly and never let the stress of a long line of customers get to them. Great job, guys! The only reason why I'm giving this location 4 stars instead of 5 is because there isn't much space to sit and work; you have to get there early if you want to post up and study or work.
author: Yvette L.

description:
Iced mint mojito! Delicious..foamy, minty, smooth coffee with a touch of sweetness. loved it.
good ambiance with plenty of seats.  definitely kid and dog friendly.  dog park is right across the street and theres a lil corner for kids to play at.  
good choices of pastries.

easy street parking and friendly neighborhood.
author: Linda T.

description:
Finally got to try this place!!
Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. SOOOOOOOO GOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOD!!
I can now die happy :)
author: Angela D.

description:
My favorite place for coffee when I'm in the SF area. I'm not sure if this is the first location I went to, but I've hit most of them up. The staff is always nice and helpful. 

BLACK COFFEE
Smooth black bold coffee is so good here. I drink my coffee with a lot of cream and sugar, but if I have to have it black, this is the place to get it.

MINT MOJITO
Amazing. 

MOCHA TESORA
Very rich and delicious. I thought the mocha was a bit too much for me at first, but it grows on you really fast.
author: Debby L.

description: This Philz is the best. It's perfect for doing work, meeting friends, eating a bagel or cookie when you just need carbs, drinking delicious coffee, everything you could ever want in a neighborhood cafe. The staff here is amazing. Their playlists are on point. Once in a while I venture to another part of the city and try a new spot, 100% of the time I regret it. I only wish they would bring back the crunch culture yogurt so I could pretend I was being healthy.
author: Cassie S.

description:
Came back home for Thanksgiving break from LA and all my friends (knowing that i'm a complete coffee addict) insisted that I MUST try Philz.

I was lucky enough to have a good friend take me on a whim. I went with what they're known for, the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee... and I must say, I was not disappointed.

Yes, it was $4 for a cup of coffee... and yes.. it might be overhyped, but damn, they have a reason to be.

The level of flavors within the cup was astonishing. The coffee was bold, the mint perfect, and the amount of sweetness, just enough to tie the drink together.

Even though it was freezing that day in SF, I couldn't have been more happy drinking my cold cup of joe.

I cannot wait for the next time i visit home, I now have another must visit place when i go home.
author: Diane T.

description:
When my parents came to visit my beloved San Francisco we literally started every morning (some days before I had to be at my desk by 9am) at Philz.  

Philiz has won me over even more; need a late afternoon pick me up? Get an iced ecstatic or a iced minto mojito.  Ether though, you are my go to.  The literary meaning is a clear sky above the clouds.  Thats how I feel when I kick back my Philz Ether cup on a 45 degree angle towards my face. Cloud like. 

They even get my just a dash of cream right which most places royally get wrong.  

I've even learned to get my guilty weekend pleasure the chocolate croisant heated to avoid the rock hard chocolate experience I once awkwardly have. 

Come one, come all.  This is my favorite go to iconic San Francisco coffee shop in a weird part of Noe Valley.  An almost well known hidden gem.
author: Andrew T.

description: Really disappointed in this location of Philz. My usual is the one in Mission (where I believe the customer service is excellent.) We were in Noe Valley and decided to bring my parents who were visiting by for a coffee. The coffee was not the issue. My dad (who has never been to Philz) picked up the wrong coffee and started drinking it thinking it was his. Long story short... instead of the staff saying "no problem at all" and just correcting the issue, they made him feel almost stupid. I witnessed this and was appalled. As a person who's had customer service experience you never make the customer feel this way. They acted dumbfounded and annoyed like this hasn't happened before. I felt really bad for him and the way he was treated while visiting his daughter. I was embarrassed that the city I love and a place I usually love had staff that didn't know how to react kindly to a customers mistake. I will definitely be staying at the Mission Philz as my regular location
author: Kelsey S.

description:
Wow. I was really impressed with this Philz. Not only was it unassuming, but also totally non intimidating due to hipster overload (looking at you, Ritual). 

This location is kind of out of the way, in terms that it wasn't packed with people and was rather quiet, considering. I was expecting a really pretentious vibe, but I got the complete opposite. It's actually very low key. The staff were very friendly and helpful. 

My iced mint mojito iced coffee was AMAZING. Seriously, the best iced coffee I've ever had. I was really skeptical, because I've been lead astray by a few rave reviews about coffee houses on Yelp, but not this time. 

Apparently every cup is made by hand, one at a time. It shows. My drink was phenomenal. There was fresh sprigs of mint as garnish and at the bottom of my cup. The flavor might sound odd, but it was refreshing, slightly sweet, creamy and still had a really good, mellow coffee taste. 

I also tried a vanilla scone and it was also really good. Scones seem hard to fuck up, but this scone was exceptionally good--not too dry, not too sweet, not too dense. 

After finishing my small coffee I toyed with the idea of going to another Philz for a second cup. I will definitely be back.
author: Bianca U.

description: Sweet staff. Smaller than other Philz, but unique & fitting to the Noe Valley neighborhood. This location is very cozy/home-y, unlike the newer locations sporadically placed in the city which are more modern/tech you (not a bad thing). But I appreciate the ambiance here & hope it never transforms. Great place for an early cup of joe...people watching...gazing out the window on a foggy day enjoying a cup of Tesora on the comfy couches. Cheers!
author: Alyssaaa S.

description:
We were in the hood to meet with friends and got to the spot way early. It was SF chilly in the air and we were in need of some coffee. When my boy said "I think there is a Bleep Bucks down the road a piece" I noticed a guy walking down the street with Philz in hand. We walked in the direction this man was coming from and ran smack dab into Philz. So money!!!!

Now, my home group location is the Mission so it took a moment to adjust to the layout. It was clean and looked shiny and new and that's not what I am used to, but the great news. Coffee is just as good as my home group. We were curious about the amount of coffee they dish out with each cup and when she showed us, I was like whoa!!! You guys hook it up! Then I noticed when you ask for cream with your coffee, it's frothy and creamy. I know, I know, my Philz pose is giving me the stank eye as they read this, but I am slow on the uptake and just noticed this. Just a subtle reminder of why I love Philz oh so very much.
author: Hector G.

description:
I love the fact they use the order ahead app. the line can be crazy sometimes and the wait to get your coffee feels like its more than 15 minutes. 

The staff is really nice and accommodating, and the pastries are pretty delicious!
author: Vi Vi V.

description: Quality has steadily declined. I order the same drink each time I've been here and there is no consistency in its flavor at all. You're better off at the Castro location.
author: Peter F.

description:
I know that it's a big point of service for Philz to have the baristas add your cream and sugar behind the counter, the only problem is they only get it right half of the time. 

They usually have to ask me 2 or 3 times to repeat my order and then they STILL get it incorrect and I'm a person orders who orders black coffee! When I order a black cup of coffee with room (so I don't burn my hand when walking with an overly full cup) I get a lecture from EVERY new barista about how they will add the cream to my taste and that they'll remake it if it's incorrect. Given Philz glacially slow pace, i could not risk spending another 15 minutes to have it remade anyway.

PHILZ: PLEASE PUT OUT CREAM AND SUGAR FOR YOUR CUSTOMERS TO ADD THEMSELVES. Your attempt to add a point of service costs you sales and the satisfaction of customers who want it right THE FIRST TIME. I shouldn't have to ENDURE A LECTURE every time they drop $4 for a cup of drip coffee.

Rant complete.
author: Christopher H.

description:
Laptop camper here. The newest Philz has become a popular laptop camping spot but it's also very popular with the stroller set. 

I was looking for their long coffee descriptions but didn't find it. The abbreviated menu is a good idea. Now all you have to do is choose your type of roast (light, medium, dark) and the notes you prefer (earthy, floral, sweet, caramel, nutty, etc.). The coffee is made one cup at a time and they can add sugar and cream for you. The experience is strange since they don't have typical espresso drinks and I'm used to adding my own sugar and cream (if I'm in the mood, usually I prefer black). 

The baked goods (croissants, muffins, scones, kouign amann) come from Starter Bakery of Oakland. They also have breakfast burritos and Clover yogurt.  

* Vanilla bean scone http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/cnjPZ4eI2lHTHIPlbHk9HQ?userid=NOUfyJW-BAo_-Cbfo8edww#Uy1TPD9MwdEauFYU_51__Q: quite nice, light and moist interior, slightly crispy edges
* Kouign amann with TCHO chocolate: impressively buttery, with thin layers of flaky dough on the outside drenched in butter and sugar, it's crispy and chewy at the same time, the cousin of a palmier
* Coffee ($3.50 for a large): intensely strong but not too harsh, strange coffee names, I favor Anesthesia to the Upside 

The free wi-fi is fast and they have plenty of small tables and power outlets. However it's too busy there to camp in peace. The employees also seem overly friendly or maybe just overly loud.

You know you love me. X0 X0, laptop camper.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Located at the far end of the 24th Street stretch the Noe Philz has a completely different vibe from the other Philz here in the city. This one is fairly low key and is never too busy. At least during the times I stop by. 

All the employees here are great - fast, efficient and friendly. 

This is the closest coffee shop to where I live and I'm definitely not complaining.
author: Esther A.

description:
5 stars. The Asian guy with long hair makes the best ice coffee. He looks a bit creepy but he's the nicest guy ever. 

Highly recommended!
author: Matthew S.

description: My go to coffee spot. Nice service, nice location, great coffee! Philtered Soul Philz way...gets me going. Or the Code 33, which will get you up and going in no time.
author: Zack K.

description:
The mint mojito iced coffee is amazing. A more legit Frappuccino, which is ideal since I'm not a huge coffee drinker. Creamy without feeling like you're drinking a milkshake. I've had coffee drinks where the mint really just doesn't work, but this one is wonderful!

The barista was super nice and helped me order since it was my first time. They also had some good looking Vegan donuts if that's your thing.
author: Sara M.

description: I am a coffee lover, retired barista, and this place is the ideal coffee spot. Amazing coffee, too many choices, all pour overs without the "I do a $10 pour over and it's super fancy." Best part is the homie vibe and amazing staff. Cartoons drawings errwhere. Wish I lived in SF!!!
author: Elise A.

description:
Gotta love Philz. 

I came in on a day I badly needed some good coffee to keep me going.  I was looking for a nice medium roast coffee that wasn't bitter, spicy, sour or burnt, characteristics of coffee from other purveyors.  They recommended the Tesora for me after I told them that typically drink Peet's.  They also asked me if I wanted coffee and cream, as they would add that for me.  I then walked over the to cashier to pay for my beverage and sat back to wait for my order.   Each cup is prepared to order so expect a bit of a wait for your coffee.  When it was ready the barista asked me to try it immediately and if it wasn't to my liking, she would make me another one.  Now THAT is service!  My cup of coffee was perfect, with just the right sized "dollop" of cream and pinch of sugar that I had requested.

There are some tables and chairs for hanging out.  This shop is on the quiet side of 24th St., which is nice for finding parking or taking the coffee across the street to the park.   Service was very friendly and helpful and the staff seemed to really care about making sure their customers leave happy.  Prices are on the high side for coffee, but at least at Philz you can taste the quality and appreciate the attention to detail.

Sometimes it pays to put your trust in others.
author: Melissa L.

description: Great stop while walking my dog. There is a place outside to leash your pup while you pick up your coffee. Just remember to OrderAhead (app name) so that its waiting for you when you get there. Depending on the weather and time of day, I'll shift between the lighter brew and dark, but all have been full of flavor and enjoyable as I would take my dog home. There is a water bowl outside and Douglas park is not far away (uphill walk though, unless you go there first like I do)
author: Raymond H.

description: Mint Mohito..makes you feel so good you'll think you are drunk. Yuuuuummmmmmm. Love The Staff at Phils. Rock Stars they are, all of them incredibly unique, creative people who are more helpful than yur own Mum! Great place but could use a little pick me up when it comes to pastries it's like, Ho Hum, this is it again! Mediocre and never changes. Boring boring BORING! Hey Phil are you listening????  ?!! get some more interesting pastry please! A little variety now and then would really help.
author: Deborah H.

description:
Working in the neighborhood for two weeks. Stop by to try my first cup of coffee here heard a lot about it was definitely worth walking three blocks for a cup of joe the ladies that work here were very helpful and informative I will definitely walk 3 blocks uphill everyday whike I'm in this neighborhood I tried there t Turkish...   I can't remember the name but it's amazing
With a mint spring. Will be back. Again again again
author: Kenneth S.

description:
Shop is located in a quaint and quiet neighborhood. Parking is very limited so it's best to order ahead w/ the app so that you can just run in and grab your cup(s) of love.


Our barista today was very nice but watered down our drinks. The taste of coffee was super mellow today so the hubs wasn't too happy. I'm not a coffee drinker so that didn't bother me that much. Oh wells...we'll be back next weekend.
author: Julie L.

description:
Thoroughly enjoyed my Tesora (recommended for being a first timer), done the "Philz" way (medium sweet and creamy?). Also, loved loved loved my friend's Mint Mojito, which I got again in San Jose driving down to So Cal....

Only thing is, the Tesora may have been too strong/acidic for my stomach? It tasted great, but my tummy hurt later.... sometimes strong coffee does have that effect on me :(.  Didn't have a problem with the large Mint Mojito that I got later!! Wish they had it in So Cal!
author: Caroline L.

description:
Full service.

Includes not only a great cup of chamomile tea but also a mint leaf, stirred in packet of Splenda and the welcoming atmosphere you've come to expect at Philz.

Concur with Crisy G. on the Sweetie Pies oat bar: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/philz-coffee-san-francisco-6?select=F0qI9VDXxz0dEoMxW-jR3A#F0qI9VDXxz0dEoMxW-jR3A. Warmed up it's even better.

WiFi was free as always (and just $6.50 for the pair above) though seating can be hard to come by. Likely because everyone is fully impressed..
author: Jason B.

description: I rated the other location already, but this place was my first Philz experience. I had the mint mojito it was sooooo dreamy and creamy! That worker now works at the Daly City locations where there is parking, but this place is awesome.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Went again on Saturday afternoon. Tried new flavors.

Tesora-medium roast. Rich in flavor and has slight cocoa taste. Smooth and easy to drink. 
Philtered Soul-medium roast. Rich and smooth and also has slight cocoa taste. But surprisingly, has strong hazelnut flavor without adding syrup. So this is now going to be my new HOT drink. It is like yummy hot chocolate for adults. Fabulous.

So far, this is my pick for COLD.
Skip Mint Mojito Iced Coffee and choose Black Estastic Iced Coffee with medium sugar and medium cream.

This is my pick for HOT.
Skip Tesora and choose Philtered Soul with medium sugar and medium cream.
author: Janice T.

description:
Great coffee.  I asked the barista for recommendation.  He suggested "wonderbar" something.  

Now if they only had a location near me.
author: Shirley N.

description: Phill please do not grow so large that you lose the local feel. I love the single drop teas and coffees . I have always felt that the baristas are friendly and helpful so not sure what happened when the people who have bad comments came in.
author: Ina D.

description: Visited SF and heard that Philz was the spot for coffee so I went and got their popular mint mojito iced coffee. I was expecting it to be sweet and creamy, but it wasn't sweet at all which was disappointing. It was a very refreshing drink though since they fill the cup with mint leaves. If you like your drinks sweet I would recommend asking them to make it sweeter.
author: Cheyne T.

description:
I love philz!

Get the iced mint mojito or any of their coffee philz way and you'll be set!
author: Christine W.

description: Coffee is great and staff is friendly. I go there nearly every day and never have had a bad experience. Staff is amazing***** so is the silken splendor!!
author: Bee G.

description:
I have been drinking coffee all my life. I do know something about it since I come from a coffee exporter country. Philz was a wonderful discovery. the wide variety and knowledge of tha baristas allows you to get exactly what you like. I understand the meaning and flavour of fresh brewed coffe therefore I enjoyed the fresh cup tha Kelly made for me.... I also liked the pace and atmosphere at Philz in Noe Valley. Tesora was fabulous, I like the essence of coffee, No  sugar no milk so this was  a delightful experience... I am looking forward to try other medium roadt and perhaps some of the light roast.
On the food side I tried the vegetable quiche, very good and light for the time, i recommed it too.
All in all a great first time at Philz !!
author: Mariel A.

description: The absolute best coffee bar in the city of San Francisco! Great staff, great coffee, great atmosphere what else could you ask for.
author: Tony G.

description: I always love Philz coffee's and service! The ambiance is cooler and less commercial feeling than Starbucks and much higher quality coffee even than Peets.
author: Tearsa H.

description: This place is so amazing. Friendly baristas who are just the nicest. Great place to grab a cup of coffee and chill or work on your computer. Ahhhh thank you Philz and Philz baristas for making my experience great every single time!!!
author: Danielle B.

description:
The customer service is great, always friendly, helpful, and most importantly - patient... especially because they're so dedicated to making your beverage "just right."

PS - Jacob's Wonderbar has held me hostage and I have Stockholm syndrome.
author: Rosavida C.

description: LOVE! I'm really going to miss Philz when I leave SF. I've tried the mint mojito, and it was really unique and delicious. I never would have thought to add mint to my coffee. I've had the turkish, and that was pretty good too. I like that everything is made fresh and easily customizable. They have a huge selection as well. The baristas are super friendly as well.
author: Trena M.

description:
Tried out a couple (medium roast) drips with soymilk this time. They were alright. It is very good coffee more a lighter taste and consistency than I think I expect them to be. They really are accomodating if you want something different from what they made you.

I also like their coffee beans for self brewing out home.

Anyhow, the staff were super awesome and kind. Perhaps I misjudged them last time.
author: E K.

description: So rare that I give places with eh-ambiance a 5 star rating but with no surprise, I give Philz Coffee FIVE STARS!!! I'm not from California so I haven't even heard of Philz's cult following before. So imagine my surprise when I looked at the menu and saw MINT MOJITO ICE COFFEE! Whaaaaaaaaaat. I didn't even need caffeine after that. I had mine with almond milk and almost cried that I didn't get a large and then actually cried when I finished it. Tried the "nutella" frappaccino too. Apparently, it was one of the girls that worked there's personal specialty and is off the menu. While it didn't taste much like nutella, it was the chocolateyist chocolate drink I've ever had. In fact, I almost wanted to quit my job and work here instead so I can enjoy unlimited premium coffee. I can't believe it took my whole life to find this place. I am SO sad I don't have this in NYC. Also, the breakfast burrito was good. The bagel with tomatoes and cucumbers in it was refreshing. The baklava was the best I've had in America (and I've been to many highly regarded Greek pastry shops here). The vegan donut was also a surprise winner, tasting better than a regular donut, feeling grease-free, and coming in fun pastel colors.
author: Lucy C.

description:
Philz can do no wrong in my books. Consistently great service and staff. And music (lets go, Talking Heads, Bowie and The Jam...). 
Although right next to Stroller Central in Noe Valley, the clientele is pretty hipster, but not irritatingly so. The whole place is also spotless, ie not a crumb on a surface to be seen. Hence I did not have an OCD freak out.
author: Caz R.

description: Awesome coffee in the SF area! I'm a frequent coffee drinker and loved Philz selection, their staff, and their cup-by-cup brewing. Excellent work.
author: Matt M.

description:
Great place to grab a coffee and head right over to the park. The cashiers taking my order were nice and friendly and the scenery outside was great on a sunny day.

If you're ever by the neighborhood, stop on by if you ever need a quick snack or a caffeine refill.
author: George Z.

description: YUMMY COFFEE!  Friendly staff and just love the old school coffee atmosphere.  These types of coffee shops are rare to come by.  I love coming here.
author: Liz D.

description: Philz is certainly one of the best coffee places in San Francisco. Their coffee is pretty much perfect, and their specialty coffee drinks are sublime. Try the Turkish! I've yet to have any food at Philz... someday.
author: Michael S.

description:
MMMMMMMMmmmmmm - Tantalizing Turkish was truly spot-on with hints of cardamon and maple. Lovely start to any day.

The line was long but moved quickly with a friendly barista at the other end. The options may be overwhelming so I'd suggest choosing through the options no Yelp while in line.
author: Vina A.

description: Stopped here for the first time on Saturday afternoon with my 2 sisters, my dad, & a friend. The little place was pretty busy, but the barista behind the counter was SO nice & took the time to ask each of us what kinds of coffee we liked & how sweet we like our coffee before giving us his suggestions. We ordered based on his personal suggestions for each of us & loved it! I will admit I should've went a little sweeter on my order (Philtered Soul), because I ended up adding 3 Splendas to it after I took a couple sips & ralized it was too strong. But that was my own fault, LOL! Loved this place & would totally go back to Philz again!
author: Radheka S.

description: Tried the Ecstatic Iced Coffee today...compared to some other flavors at Philz, it's a little more tame which I thoroughly enjoyed. This location also seems less busy than others, but then again, I did come in relatively early for a Saturday morning.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Very good coffee, but this place needs a facelift. The decor is just a little schlubby.

The food could also use an upgrade. There are no healthy options on the menu - but I've figured out the perfect Philz hack. Cucumber with hummus. It's not on the menu, but they can make it. It's delicious.
author: Laura C.

description: I placed an order that took 15 minutes to fulfill because the server took another seven orders AFTER my order. Be sure to keep track of your order and wait time as the servers can become overwhelmed; sometimes forgetting orders.
author: Charlie A.

description: I am sure it is good for people that drink hot cofee but this review is for the iced coffee. I was not a fan. They put it in a normal cup with a hot coffee lid and then squeeze the straw through it?  I will be back if they ever start using iced coffee cups. They have great people working there, very friendly and helpful!
author: Louie M.

description: Love love love Philz! Philz coffee is addicting. My favorite indulgence is their iced mocha. Also love the iced mint mojito. Both feel like special occasion coffees. Perfect on a sunny day.
author: Rosalyn W.

description: Quality coffee, cozy spot to work, and good vibes. Despite having heavy traffic they never complained about me working there (sometimes for hours on end). A great way to start the day. Only complaint is they would always open the windows when it was cold haha, I guess because they would get hot behind the counter.
author: Aljosha N.

description: I am and will forever be in love with mint mojito iced coffee. sweet, creamy, minty. for 50 cents more, you can order it large. i hope someday philz coffee will open in la. otherwise, i'll be returning here every chance i'm in sf.
author: Cheryl P.

description:
I've tried time and time again to let this place redeem itself but now I'm convinced they just don't want my business.

don't use the OrderAhead app here, they don't take the time to actually read your order. the first time they got it wrong: "ok... your busy." the second time: "um... alright. didn't think my order was so difficult." the third time: "alright, why don't you go ahead and just make whatever you feel like making. that seems to be what you do anyway."

maybe it's because I'm ordering tea? this IS a coffee place. perhaps tea is too much to ask.

all I want is black iced tea, no sweetener and no cream or milk. how is that so difficult?
author: danielle m.

description: Normally 5 but went ahead and ordered on order ahead app and ordered my crack coffee, mint mojito sweet and creamy. Yes creamy, no sugar. I appreciate the sentiment that they thought I was sweet enough but daddy needs his sugar.
author: Jonathan T.

description: Waited far too long to have the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee at Philz.  I'm very impressed with the operation at Philz.. the one cup at a time attitude is essential for a good cup of coffee!
