I am not huge fan of mint in general, but I loved the mint mojito iced coffee here... husband ordered the gingersnap and it was just as good!  Must come back to try more!
author: Reena P.

description:
One of the best coffee joints in town. Every Philz place has it's own vibe but the coffee and service is consistently on point no matter which one you go to. The staff are friendly and always asks you to take a sip of your drink  before you head out to make sure you are satisfied with it.

I don't think you can go wrong with whatever you choose to order here, so far what I've tried I've loved. That includes: philz chai, anesthesia, mint mojito, ambrosia, tesora.

This location has everything above and also a small kid section of books/toys. It can get crowded which makes it hard to find seat and enjoy your drink. Parking around the area is easier compared to other locations!
author: Loriel L.

description:
mint mojito
like if you haven't, u just gotta try it
if you like viet iced coffee, this is nothing like it but you'll love it, trust me
definitely one of the cooler takes on iced coffee
if you're going for a good latin american blend, get silken splendor
author: Thankie S.

description:
Silken splendor, hazelnut, light milk, light sugar. Yum!!

This is my absolute favorite place to study. I feel somewhat guilty for hoping it doesn't get insanely busy because I like my table-space. You'll find me here early in the morning (so awesome because they open at six) sipping on my morning coffee studying away. The staff are so friendly and are never shy to start a conversation. There are plenty of outlets so every table is a 'good table'. Great place to spend a morning :)
author: Mish L.

description:
Absolutely amazing! Bravo, Philz coffee! 

Warm day: mint mojito or ginger snap

Cold day: New Manhattan (lots of caffeine and extremely delicious)  or Citrus Grapefruit coffee.  

Mocha is also pretty good but not different than other mochas. 

Philz coffee, you make the coffee a better experience. 

Viva Philz coffee!!!
author: Alex R.

description: Mint mojito coffee! Not flavors that you would expect together but they work surprisingly well. However they literally add a clump of mint to your cup, which means you're getting less coffee for your buck. But the pumpkin bread was really good
author: Sonia V.

description: My first time here and it is awesome compare to my first experience in "The Origninal Philz" one. The barista was pleasant and asked how sweet I'd like my coffee and I think that is important if the coffee drinker like me is cutting down on sugar intake. And most especially more important is he told me to taste it and see how much I like it and if not offered to make me another one. It tasted awesome! Needless to say, I will be back here in a heartbeat...no doubt! I forgot to mention how cute the barista was! If I could I'd give this place 10 stars for awesome cute service, awesome spot that accommodates pets and children, awesome community and I luv that there's a little playground across the street!!! Definitely two thumbs up!
author: Leila G.

description:
My cousin-in-law has been begging me to take her to Philz Coffee! Finally had the chance to take her and she loved it! 

Came here during the middle of the day during a weekday. Located in a quiet neighborhood. Parking isn't too hard, as it's street/residential parking. There's a small kids park across the street. The place was clean and organized. Staff is super friendly and efficient. We came in, the staff took our order and when he finished making the drink, he told my in-law to take a sip. He asked if the drink was good cause he wanted it to perfect and afterwards, we walked up to the cashier to pay. Great customer service! My in-law loved their coffee so much, she's begging me to take her back!
author: Mandy G.

description: For me this is the best coffee in the bay area.  Its unfortunate that they are just located in SF (one in Daly City).
author: Gino C.

description: Simply the best cup of coffee in SF.  I frequent this location because I just moved into the neighborhood and love the friendly service and efficiency of the staff.  Although they brew each cup one at a time, they somehow keep the lines moving.  Definitely worth the wait and the extra splurge every day.  Thank you Philz for starting my mornings on a good note!
author: louis a.

description:
3 stars b/c it's Philz so it is good by nature. Not 5 stars because the barista messed up my coffee - and made me feel like an idiot for asking for an iced coffee on an overcast (but still summer) day. 

"Do you want ice in your coffee to cool it off or do you want an iced coffee?" Not sure if confused or judging me.

"I want an iced coffee". (like I get in Mountain View all the time)

The coffee came out - without ice - but she managed to make it watery and very weird tasting. It didn't have the strength of my regular philtered soul, so I know it wasn't just her ice snafu that messed up this coffee. 

Medium cream and sugar in MV or PA Philz usually comes out a light beige color, with big ice cubes on top. The color of this coffee was very dark, not creamy at all. Sweet, but not creamy. Watery.

Okay, enough about the one coffee - who cares? This is still Philz and Philz is amazing!!!!!! And the barista offered to remake it, so I have literally nothing to complain about. Do not make too much of my experience above and JUST GO. 

I'm sure my next coffee there will be great. Will definitely try again...cuz PHILZ!

P.S. I see one of the shared photos is an iced coffee with big ice cubes - just how it's supposed to look! So you see, I could have had my coffee remade and all would have been well - it was just a morning miscommunication.

GO TO PHILZ!!
author: Cassie H.

description: I've had mixed experiences at Philz, but overall -- they make good on their word, and the coffee is truly yummy.
author: Scott S.

description: Just had a perfect philharmonic as well as a Yerba mate tea. The service was wonderful and max was super kind. We were surprised to hear a very generous person donated a $50 gift card to treat strangers to coffee. Just asking others to pay it forward. I work down the street and it makes me very happy to see Noe paying kindness forward with a simple gesture. I couldn't ask for a better surprise in a simple coffee run, and not to mention loads of smiles and impeccable service. Pay it forward, it feels incredible! Thank you random kind strangers!
author: Juliana O.

description:
I'm a big coffee shop junkie and Philz Coffee did not disappoint. Upon walking in there's a hip and comfy atmosphere. There's enough lights coming in from the outside, in addition to little tube lights dangling from the ceiling. Really love the selection of music that they play. The workers look like they're having a good time and there's just enough seating that if you want to sit here with your laptop, you certainly can. This is one of those nifty little study spaces around the corner of the street!

RECOMMEND: Ecstatic Ice Coffee with sugar & cream, medium sweetness. The coffee is creamy but not too overwhelming. It's the perfect blend.
author: Ting Jung L.

description: Really delicious iced coffee, no sugar or cream necessary. Michelle is one of the most welcoming Philz employee's. Her drinks are always on point, her smile and warmth are an added bonus. Love the atmosphere of this philz.
author: Danelia L.

description: How nice it is to be able to talk to a Barista that's more like the sommelier of coffee. Never even thought of doing that before Philz.
author: Ottis M.

description:
I don't really get the hype.  Place is mobbed, no where to sit.   Incredibly confusing in where to order and pay.  Takes forever to get a cup of coffee which is fine, but no better than Peets,  Hate that they have to put the milk in.  It 's also about a buck more than any other place in town.

Takes forever to get a cup of coffee.

Staff is really nice.
author: Dennis N.

description:
oh man.  Philz Coffee in San Francisco is one of the best coffee places ever created.  My friend who is a cop in the area loves this place and he recommended we go there.  So we got the Mojito ice coffee and dear god, I was in coffee heaven.  The minty fresh taste blended with the cold soothing air of delicious brain-blasting coffee endured through my taste buds, with a freshful aftertaste.  This was so amazingly good.  I almost wished I lived in san francisco, to just sit down, enjoy a novel, write on my laptop, and ponder the simplicity of life, in this frank studious milieu of other similarly thinking folks.  Philz coffee is an A+ of coffee places.  A fancy delicious coffee.

Pro tip:  if you're getting it to go, call it in and order over the phone, the drinks can take 5-10 minutes to make, but thank goodness for the honest amount of time into making this delicious cup of coffee.  

Cheeeeers and 5 stars to this place.  *sip sip*  *herbal minty taste*  *yum yum*
author: Sep S.

description:
I absolutely love Philz and was thrilled to have this open in my neighborhood. The coffee is perfect, and I love the on-going staff. My ONLY complaint is that, now that they've made this a training store, the quality of service and coffee has gone down. The trainees aren't overseen well and often don't know what they're doing. And, while the on-going staff all make consistent coffee, I am always unpleasantly surprised when a trainee messes up. 

Please don't put all your trainees at my Philz!!!
author: Bob C.

description:
Seriously, they should change their motto to, "Joy . . . one cup at a time." because lets get real, a little Tantalizing Turkish to greet the cool morning or a refreshing Mint Mojito to sweeten a lazy afternoon is what they offer.

This particular Philz feel like a happy medium between the dot-commie-hipster Mission Bay Store and the edgy-hipster Mission location. With plenty of room, free wifi and adequate outlets, this has become on of the regular "offices"

Most of the staff are extremely friendly with a few always walking that tightrope of snarkiness that might turn folks off, but hey, that's part of the charm.

An extra bonus is that whomever handles their social media is top-notch, responding to tweets and instagram posts like a social sedia ninja monkey dragon god.

VEGANS: Try the Vegan Donuts that they have delivered. Yummy.
author: Bruce R.

description:
I suppose this is the place to go if you're really into the roast of your coffee and have A LOT of time on your hands. 

On the other hand, if you're hoping to grab a drink and a pastry before the bus comes, save yourself the time and stress and go elsewhere, you're going to miss that bus. I hadn't been before, but knew Philz makes their coffee one cup at a time, and as I was in a hurry I just ordered a tea and then I waited. And waited, and waited and waited while the bus came and went. I know how to steep tea, I don't need it done for me, especially since their tea turned out to be relatively weak and flavorless tea anyway. Also, donuts should be delicious on their own, they shouldn't need half an inch of icing on them to be good, it just makes them taste like bad grocery store birthday cake. 3 stars is a generous rounding up, 2 seemed just a bit too low.

If I have an hour to kill, and no other options, I might go back, maybe I'll get my drink before my laptop battery dies.
author: MacKenzie H.

description: None of the subsequent outposts of Philz has ever been as funky as the one in the Mission. As long as they keep pumping out excellent Ecstatic iced's, Im down.
author: Kim N.

description:
I've regularly gone to the philz in the castro and on golden gate and had wonderful experiences. I'm temporarily living near noe valley and wanted to try this place several times before writing a negative review.

The staff here are lovely but the SLOWEST in the world. This morning it took 15 minutes to get my coffee (I was timing) and there were only 2 people in front of me when I walked in. Can't imagine how long it would take if it was actually busy. 

Today wasn't a fluke either. Its painstakingly slow which if you're not on your way to work, would be fine, they need to get on it.
author: Sean H.

description:
As part of my quest to review every coffee chop in San Francisco, here is my review of Philz Coffee in Noe Valley:

- Same great strong made-to-order drip coffee and sophisticated coffee brewers as you can expect from Philz.
- Great choices of non-coffee drinks and pastries compared to the average coffee shop.
- Small venue, but still lots of seating.
- Cleaner venue and better, more modern furniture than other coffee shops or other Philz.
- Crowd is typical of the neighborhoud: strollers, babies, kids, students, tech geeks coding on their Mac. Not as crazy hipsterish or touristy than other Philz.
- Crowd is super friendly.
- Same great hipster music as other Philz.
author: Nico B.

description:
Philz is one of those weird Bay area establishments that is hoisted on its own petard, and worthy of exactly zero of the hype surrounding it.

I've been here to this location a couple times, and it felt like a bad Portlandia episode. I asked if they had any non-dairy options for the gingersnap coffee. The girl behind the counter couldn't remember if they had non-dairy options. 'Like almond milk?' Yes, like almond milk. That would be fine. And then ensued a two minute conversation about how she can't remember which is dairy and which isn't. I said, 'Milk is dairy. Everything else is non-dairy.' She was all, oh yeah, teehee. It was unbelievable. Was she wasted? One of the other guys, clearly the manager, came over and spoke past her mumbling and fumbling, said yes, they can do almond for the drink. Great. Ordered it. How sweet do I want it? I don't know, medium?

Five minutes later she hands me a drink with so much clove in it that the tip of my tongue went numb. There was no sugar in it. I handed it back for a little sugar. She put maybe a teaspoon in, said to taste it. I decided, fuck this, I'll drink it, it's good enough. 
I swear she was tripping her face off from last night's acid. 

The other guy, the one who wasn't tripping, and wasn't the manager, made my bagel. I watched as he lovingly massaged hummus into both halves of my toasted bagel, then shoved both halves face to face, and wrapped it up. Oh, logic. Why must you evade so many service people in this world? 

I wouldn't be so damn picky if a) I hadn't had all of these jobs before and been trained to do them right, and b) didn't know how hard it ISN'T to do correctly. It's all in the training. Sad, Philz. So sad.

(I can't speak for any other branches of this coffee chain, and I don't know that I ever will.)
author: Amani Ellen L.

description:
Two words for those of you that don't know: MINT. MOJITO. I'm not much of a coffee drinker, but I have to say, I'm in love with it and had this drink at least 3 times during my 5 day vacation in SF.

For the first timers like me, you order your drink with a Barista first, pay at the front and wait for your drink. Once your drink is made, you can taste it to make sure it's exactly how you want it, if not, they'll make it sweeter, add more chocolate, etc. 

It's a great coffee shop, cool atmosphere, and I got to meet Phil himself!
author: Sammie T.

description:
Philz never disappoints. Great coffee and great service. No matter which Philz you decide to go to they are always consistent. They make each cup to order and don't charge extra for soy. If you aren't a big coffee drinker their tea is good too. Try the Istanbul Treat.

On a hot day when you're craving a cold drink, get the Mint Mojito.
author: Jennifer H.

description: The Mint Mojito is as good as people say. I removed the fresh mint leaf from the top though because it was registering on my palate as too savory, if that makes sense. But I loved the background mint flavor. The chocolate croissant was one of the best I've had. And I may have also gotten an almond croissant. And hypothetically speaking that was really good too...
author: Emma H.

description:
My favorite Philz location. You probably already know what to expect from their coffee and snacks but this place also has the added benefit of an amazon locker in store and easy access to the 48 bus line right in front of the place. 

Only thing that would make it better would be more outdoor seating.
author: Baron C.

description:
Not that Philz needs another review, but I agree with everyone else. 

This location is pretty small, with limited seating, so just be prepared to wait for seats or take your coffeee elsewhere. 

Iced Mint Mojito though is SO DELICIOUS. I'm not a huge coffee fan. I mean I'll drink it, but I like a lot of sugar and prefer sugary coffee drinks, but this was a perfect blend of not too sweet, but still tasty. 

Still craving it. 

Also had this flaky, dense, croissant-like pastry that the worker recommended. It was also delish. 

I will be back!
author: Alison N.

description:
i was skeptical when my friend introduced me to this coffee place raving about the mojito mint iced coffee. i just tot its like any other ice coffee with mint leaves on top.

i was terribly wrong. it was love at 1st sip. e mint leaves r not just garnished at e top but its also infused in e coffee with crushed mint leaves. ice minty taste with every sip of the coffee is just refreshing. 

ive not tried any other coffee here as i just cant resist ordering e same thing over and over again.
author: Linda L.

description: Like a parallel universe - a non-hipstery/non-sceney Philz? Is the apocalype upon us?
author: Andrew K.

description: This philz is on point. Very nice staff and locals make this a special spot. I came to do some work for a couple days. The wireless was dependable, space was plentiful, coffee was great as usual and all staff are very attentive. I'll be coming back often.
author: Mike O.

description: This used to be my favorite Philz location but the quality has gone downhill. There have been multiple times where I've had them remake my go-to drink, an iced mocha tesora.
author: Catherine L.

description: One of the worst coffees I've tried in town. Typical Mission District make-believe piece of trash. Also, their bulk rice had live animals/bugs in it! UNACCEPTABLE!!!
author: Raymond F.

description: I love Philz and this location is especially great. I usually use order ahead since, as with all Philz, the line is crazy long in the mornings. As a result I might come in without my wallet. One day I wanted a pastry to go with my coffee, and since I couldn't order if from my phone the manger threw it in for free! Get us back next time he said. I love the neighborhood coffee shop fee with big city coffee. Will continue to be my go to spot.
author: Theresa J.

description:
Great place for a Philz! 

I had tried their ginger snap, regular iced coffee but the mint mojito is still my favorite one. 
Prices are average. 
Workers are always cheerful and very enthusiastic here.
author: Ubb S.

description:
I am left paralyzed with a feeling of excitement to learn that I live within a 3 block radius of this new Philz..  

Life is about to get so much better..
author: Ty T.

description:
Dear Phil, 

GAS IS EXPENSIVE..
Y U NO MAKE RICHMOND DISTRICT LOCATION!?!?

I need your coffee so I can..

Get my GTL pump! no curls, no girls amiright!?
     and..
Stay awake for the 25th hour..
     and..
ACTUALLY UNDERSTAND MATH. Yes, I know I'm Chinese *!@#$%^&*
     and..
Do STUPID things FASTER, with MORE energy!

Love, 
Albert L.
author: Albert L.

description:
I just moved to SF from Seattle, where people are scary serious about coffee. Without really realizing it, I became accustomed to a certain level of quality and flavor in my coffee beverages. This can be disappointing to forget when you travel and expect coffee to be good - I couldn't seem to find the good coffee in NYC no matter how hard I tried, so I'm a little wary of the coffee in foreign cities, even the big ones.

When I first arrived in SF, my temporary apartment was across the street from a Philz. From the looks of the logo (I'm superficial?) I thought the place was going to be like a chain Peet's-style coffee joint. I was hesitant, especially after all my bad coffee experiences in other cities, so I consulted Yelp. Yelp people say it's amazing, so I tried it.

Holy @#)(*@#. I thought I had already tasted the best coffee of my life, but upon my first sip of a creamy, sweetened cup of Philharmonic, I realized I hadn't until now! I know this is a really dramatic review, but I'm being serious. It was show-stoppingly delicious and I've been hooked ever since. I prefer Philz to all the hip, Seattle-esque espresso places SF boasts about like Blue Bottle and Ritual, etc. It's just more my thing, I suppose.

Now I live near the Noe Valley Philz, and I head over there a few times a week for a large Philharmonic. It's so good, I have a hard time ordering anything else, though I have tried the Jacob's Wonderbar and Tesora, which are also good but not as special as the Philharmonic blend, which they add cardamom to. I've actually started adding cardamom to my (Philz) coffee at home because it's so comforting and delicious.

So yeah. I'm a huge fan of Philz. The Noe Valley shop is really chill. I always find a nearby parking spot and usually get a table when I need one, else I just read outside on a bench. The people working here are extremely friendly and there are lots of babies and dogs around. Love it.


PS: if you're unaffected by copious amounts of sugar, definitely try a donut with your coffee. I like the regular glazed ones. They go so well with the coffee. I just found out they're local vegan donuts! Way good, regardless.
author: Sherah S.

description:
Ok California what are you putting in this stuff! good Lord Above I never dreamed it would be line this. like CRACKSAUCE. no wonder yall talk so fast around here!  

i love how friendly people in this part of town. I am used to tourists and crowds and the bums.. not here! wish all of San Francisco could be this clean. 

she put a piece of mint in my cup which I did like. fresh and foamy creamed coffee. the new best coffee I had!
author: Agatha K.

description:
Great addition to the neighborhood. Right across from the playground and dog park, and still quality coffee. Creamy and sweet, just I've always liked it.

Staff is pretty darned helpful. Thanks Carlo, Alisha and Tamara and Nicki.
author: Mickey A.

description:
Do you love coffee? Do you love mojitos? If so, then you must order Philz' mint mojito coffee as it is the almost perfect combo of the two. It's almost perfect because it is made virgin. 

As an espresso lover, the mint mojito coffee may just be the best liquid that has ever been in my mouth. Every time I approach a Philz, my heart beats a little faster, and my body is overwhelmed with ecstasy as I anticipate the mint mojito dripping onto my taste buds. It feeds my caffeine addiction every time, and it makes me smile just a little brighter! 

Also, I had their green tea before. My spoiled taste buds think it's just okay. It's better than your Tazo tea bags, but it's on the same playing field as your loose leave teas from any Chinese tea shop. So, if you're at a Philz, don't waste your energy ordering green teas, and just go ahead and treat yourself to a mint mojito. You'll be a happier person!
author: Mabel Y.

description: One of my favorite cafes to hang out at. And by far one of the friendliest cafe staff for miles around. And this is San Francisco.  There are a lot of good cafes everywhere. One of the best perks of this place is watching adorable kids get all excited about the little play corner they have here, and cute dogs outside getting  happy when their owners come out. And there is, of course, the coffee! Jacob's Wunderbar is my favorite. Good stuff.
author: Averros A.

description:
Never been to a Philz before, but me likey! The baristas are very nice and helpful - the menu is a bit confusing. And, oh, my, GOD, those cookies are KILLER! 

Located across from a cool park, this place is definitely a great hang with nice options for a little bite to eat and good coffee.
author: Mary M.

description:
DAAANG, I didn't know there was a Philz here!! Where have I been?? My friend and I were happily lunching @ Barney's when I decided to look up how far we were from Castro's Philz when I realized we weren't more than 2 blocks away from this one. 
SA-WEEEEET! Just how I like my Philz. 

I love the iced mint mojito, but my friend chose the iced gingersnap and HELLO!!! Why doesn't this one get as much love?? The mojito is great but every sip leaves mint specks in my mouth which I can do without. Anyway, I think the gingersnap may be my new fav. 

I had the new manhattan which was delish as usual. =) 

Thank you Philz for making my day =)
author: Christine Y.

description: The mocha is good and the service is superb. Their mission statement on the wall says ' Our Mission: To Better Your Day' , and they really do that well.
author: Michael L.

description: I make sure to stop at this place when I visit San Francisco. I love the unique choices they have and probably my favorite is the Mocha Tesora. Every time we're in San Francisco, we make sure we get our coffee here plus the drive down the hill is just fun, it's like riding in a roller coaster!! The staff is really nice. I remember when I first came here that I don't know what I'm getting and they just asked me what I was in the mood for and suggested the Mocha Tesora. The place is nicely decorated and it's not too crowded either. That's why I rather go to a locally owned coffee shop that doesn't rush you to order and worst get pissed that you are taking so much of your time. I love everything about their interior, quality and their inexpensive price as well, down to the staff.I love that they the temperature for the coffee is perfect,unlike the mainstream coffee shops that make sure you won't appreciate taste for a couple of days  This location is my favorite. I'm sure other locations are equally awesome but this is the closest one to where my family lives. I miss this place right at this very moment.
author: Marvic R.

description: My ambrosia was just right and extra hot--the way I like it!  Barista was friendly.  Nice to have a Philz where there's plenty of tables and plugs.  Unlike other Philz Coffee stores I've been to, this one wasn't as crowded.  Would definitely come here again.
author: Victoria L.

description: I'm a coffee newbie. I love the Mint Mojito but I still am just not gonna be a coffee lady. So.... I came in there for the first time by myself (normally I am just going with someone else). OMG. BIG GIRL THINGS! And I got a mocha tesora. sweet, creamy and soy. I don't know if I chose anything else but It was delish! DAMN. I want one now.. gonna end this and go get one. I liked the staff there. never the same and always nice! works for me lol.
author: Sweets N.

description:
Excellent service, excellent coffee (takes a while), very clean facility. Recommend the iced mint mojito.

Phil, you need to honor military either 100% of the time, or not at all.  Your employees should be on the same page.
author: Karin E.

description:
One of life's mysteries to me is that people are willing to regularly spend 20 minutes of their day just to order their coffee... 10 minutes to stand in line to get served, and 10 minutes for the coffee to be called --day in day out at the Noe Philz during the busy times.   Yes, the coffee is delicious, but I've had to walk out of the store on several occasions when my spot in the line hadn't even moved in the time I would have finished drinking a coffee elsewhere.  

Thankfully, my husband discovered the OrderAhead app, which lets you order the coffee and pick it up at the counter as you walk in, fully paid (though the app doesn't handle the tip yet).  We can indulge in our favorite Philz blends again.
author: Antje K.

description:
I like Philz because they personalize your coffee. You don't really get this service at a Stabucks. It's surprising bc it's a chain. I wish it was located closer to me. I love their mojito iced coffee and the normal iced coffees. 

I think parking sucks at this location, but that's SF for you.
author: Jenna L.

description:
Love the original and innovative caffeine and non-caffeine offerings they have. I drive past Starbucks, Peets, and now Coffee Bean Tea Leaf......straight over to Philz. No one else has what they have and I've realized that they HAVE exactly what I always want no matter if its a caffeine day or not!!

Mint Mojito Iced Coffee, Fresh Mint Tea.....ahhhh yeahhhh
author: Lee M.

description:
I love this quaint location tucked away in noe valley! 
I've come here early in the morning to pick up much needed philz for classmates before an important test and in the mid-afternoon for a pick me up and it's always been a calm vibe (esp compared to the one in the castro or even the one in palo alto). The baristas are helpful and essentially everything else is the same as far as the taste goes. 

If you really haven't had philz and you live in the bay area - get with it. as many of my friends have said, "it's like crack." no joke. 
(favorites include: ambrosia, iced coffee, iced mint mojito, mocha tesora, turkish delight depending on how sweet you like your coffee)
author: Tim B.

description:
These days I'm too busy being FUNemployed to write many reviews, but I had to come out of hibernation for this one.  Now I've given a fair number of 5-star reviews, but let me just say that this is one of the more solid of those, a legit 5.0 if you expand the rating points system to an additional significant figure.

Now I've been a Philz fan for awhile.  I've been to 6 different locations and of course was into it waaaaaay before it was cool (no hipster).  This new location is perhaps the best yet.  The vibe in the place is great, the staff is extremely friendly, it's far enough out of the way that it doesn't get that crowded, and of course it has Philz coffee.  If that last part doesn't mean anything to you, read on, because it should.  

It's hard to put into words how much better Philz is than, say, Starbucks.  I think some comparisons from classic comedies will give you some perspective.  Let's just say that Starbucks is that crappy house party you threw that nobody came to and Philz is the F**KING CATALINA WINE MIXER.  In the coffee world, Philz is pretty much Veronica Vaughn (soooo hot, want to touch the hiney) and other places are Principal Max Anderson.  In more discrete terms, the coffee is bursting with flavor, has little acidity, and is exceedingly smooth.  Just trust me that it has the best coffee any place that has a significant presence in the Bay Area.  If you haven't had it, you should get it now, even if it means selling your dead bird to a blind kid, trading in your sheepdog van for a moped, and driving all the way to Aspen.  Just do it.
author: Nick D.

description:
There are some things that make us Bayareans well..Bayareans (c).   I think that Philz is one of them.  Which is why I'm ashamed to say that Philz isn't one of my favorite coffee joints.

There's nothing wrong with Philz per-se, they serve exotic drip coffees like the infamous mojito or the Turkish which i enjoy but none of my friends do.
It's just that most days I just want a simple, clean, strong cup of espresso and Philz doesn't roll that way!

When people visit SF I always tell them to try Philz, but to really experience the art and craftsmanship of the Bay area baristas, then there are a few other places to consider besides Philz.

On the note of this location: Great service, plenty of parking, nice and clean.  As far as Philz go, this location is a winner.
author: Anthony L.

description: I am a fan. But the expense of a cup is brutal. They have so many different options. and brew one cup at a time. It's definitely worth the wait, and the staff is always down to earth. This is the plzce to get your modern punk hipster on. mohawks, side shaved headed girls, tatted up, flannels, cut off skinny jeans, and cuffed high rises with  busted chuck taylors on and thick framed glasses.. this is the spot. the only reason the star is taken off is some people just can't afford it.. 3 Dollars for a small is a LOT of money.
author: Vinny T.

description:
So this rather unfortunate, but absolutely hilarious and somewhat sweet story/review is mainly for the super nice barista with the glasses and (pink? some kind of bright color) streaks in her hair.

It was Valentine's Day, and probably one of the most memorable starts to any Valentine's Day I've had. I was suffering from a MASSIVE hangover due to the craziness of the previous night. I wanted some coffee and my Valentine suggested we go to Philz since he's never been and wanted to try the iced mint mojito everyone raves about. We walked in and this particular barista greeted us very warmly and had such a bubbly personality. She highly suggested that we get the iced mint mojitos super creamy and sweet since it's her favorite, and so we did. 

So while we waited for our drinks, he decided to sit near the back at the only table with the two high chairs. We sat down and I immediately noticed the table top was pretty wobbly....that should've already been a red flag to switch to a different table. But we stayed anyway. 

We heard our drinks being called and he got up to retrieve them. He handed me my drink and I immediately started sipping on it. So let me point out that my beverage had been in my hands the moment he handed me my cup. I DID NOT SET MY DRINK DOWN ON THE TABLE AT ALL. He, on the other hand, took ONE SIP and then made the biggest mistake of setting his drink down (with no hands for support) and slightly leaning his arms on the table. 

NOW WHAT HAPPENED NEXT seriously appeared in slow motion for me. I see the table lean towards him and his cup wobbling back and forth, deciding whether or not to tip over. The coffee gods decided to be mean so the cup was pretty much leaning over towards him...and of course he wasn't paying attention. At this point, I had a flash of the epic spilldown that was about to ensue. Again, picture SLOW-MO: I reached my hand out to try to grab his cup whilst screaming, "NooOOOoOOOOOoo!" but was a little too late....and all I could see was his terrified facial expression and his coffee spill all over his pants and shoes as well as hear loud splatters of coffee and ice hit the ground (again...in SLOW-MO). All I could do was put my non-cup-holding-hand over my mouth in total shock. Horrified, he rushed to the bathroom to clean himself up. Little side note: This was probably our 3rd date together and I know he was trying really hard to make a good impression....so I know this catastrophe was pretty embarrassing for him. But as bad as I felt, I couldn't help but get a huge kick out of it hahahahha. I know, I'm horrible. 

ANYWAYS, BACK TO THE AWESOME BARISTA. So he finally came out of the bathroom after 15 minutes and we sat down (at a different table obviously). There was a brief moment of silence....I could just see the embarrassment in his face and so I tried comforting him. Shortly afterwards, the same barista came out and personally handed him a freshly made iced mint mojito!!! He kept saying that he was sorry and that she didn't have to do that, and she replied (not exactly verbatim), "IF I SAW AN ICED MINT MOJITO SPILL ALL OVER THE GROUND, I WOULD BE HEARTBROKEN! ABSOLUTELY HEARTBROKEN! SO PLEASE, LET ME DO THIS FOR YOU!" Instant five stars right there for this barista being a damn rockstar!!! 

So about 30 minutes after the fiasco, we finally got to enjoy our beverages together. I couldn't help but replay the event in slow-mo in my mind so I kept laughing to myself (and at him ahhahha). But hey, at least it cured my hangover AND he won another date with me - so not all was lost ;) 

Moral of the story: Avoid the table with the two high chairs.

UPDATE: Less than 2 months after my posting of this review, I find out he's actually a complete d-bag (go figure!) I no longer feel bad about laughing hysterically in his face. *drops mic
author: Tee C.

description: The coffee is great. The worker that makes the coffee is beyond rude. Ordered my drink less minty and he made it extra. Instead of fixing it he forced it on me saying I would like it more. Avoid this location...
author: Bert N.

description:
As always, good stuff from Philz. The location isn't in the middle of the Noe 24th street craziness, which is good and bad...slightly out of the way, but not overrun with people. All of the coffee I've had here is great and worth going out of your way for.

Philz seems to be way more in the "grab your coffee and go" market than "sit and chill for a while" market. I wish there was more seating at this place as the couch looks really comfortable but isn't that comfortable. I also wish it didn't take quite so long to make most of the coffee. BUT I guess that's okay because it is really delicious.

Glad to have a Philz closer to home that isn't quite as crowded as the one in the Mission!
author: Justin S.

description:
What a gem!  I've greatly enjoyed other Philz I've been to, and this is no exception.  Wonderfully warm and helpful employees, a comfortable space, and right near ample street parking and a cute dog park!

Minus one star because my decaf coffee wasn't quite as perfect as I've had at other Philz locations; just a tad bitter this time.  But whenever I'm near that area, I'll definitely be back.  Might even buy one of their mugs, which give the bearers a large size for the price of a small :-)  Hooray for good deals and environmentally friendly proddings :D
author: Adam L.

description:
I didn't know coffee could be this good. 

The first time I stopped in, I asked for a recommendation and the friendly barista suggested the Tesora. It was absolutely divine. My husband ordered the Mint Mojito iced coffee, which was equally amazing. Every time I go to Philz, I order one of these two options, although I keep telling myself I'll branch out and try some of their other drinks. I'd be willing to bet they're all pretty delicious.
author: Shannon K.

description:
When a group of us visited the Noe Valley location, a friend of ours asked what was the most popular drink they had and the barista answer was "Mint Mojito, it is the most popular and also the most time consuming of all the drinks BUT we will be happy to make you one." 

My first thought was "Um okay, you don't like making that drink." I mean who would say that to a customer? Another difference between this and the Noe Valley location is that one feels quite the pretentious place to be in. I will give them the benefit of the doubt that it was an off day but c'mon dont make a sly remark that it'll take you awhile to make a drink even if it does plus exacerbate the situation when you leave in the middle of making the drink to take your break and hand it off to a coworker. 

From all the other Philz Coffees, this is by far the cleanest and that alone earns it a star. My friend counted people diligently working on 11 different Macbook Pros while the only diligent thing I noticed in the SJ location was students and regular ol'folks getting their caffeine high.  What stood out the most was the famed mint mojito iced coffee in Noe Valley tasted like a plain iced coffee you can purchase for a cheaper price at your local Starbucks. My friend seemed like he was tempted to throw his coffee to the ground and I couldn't blame him. The caffeine lovers are a special bunch.  

Would I be back?
Probably not since there are other locations to go too.
author: James S.

description: Wonderful staff and coffee! It was my first time at philz and I got the Mocha Terosa. I told the barista to not make it too sweet and she did it perfectly!
author: Henry F.

description:
I am not that much into coffee but this place is a nice addition to the neighborhood. It is a great size and unique enough that it is by far nothing like starbucks.

The ppl that work at Philz could not be nicer and I really am impressed with their commitment to their craft. On opening  day I had the luck of meeting Phiz himself. He was down to earth. Extremely personable and we chatted for sometime. Fantastic guy and really appreciate him having a shop in Noe Valley!
author: Ryan B.

description:
Awesome staff, delicious coffee and clean place!

Parking around here is pretty rough depending on what time you come in. 

It's not your "in and out" cup of coffee.. For philz, you need to come in, order your drink... and wait. You must wait for this delicious cup of warmth and happiness.

Everything good you hear about Philz Coffee is true. Go see for yourself =)
author: Neek W.

description:
I give Philz 4 stars because of their amazing service, their staff and their workers.

I'm not going to complain about the parking, because what do you expect? It's San Francisco. This review is solely on the business itself which I appreciate. 

What I like
-Fast service even when the lines look long
-Before you pick up your drink, they ask you to taste it to see if you like it, if you don't they're make you another one or they're adjust it to your liking
-The famous mint mojito is probably the best thing on the menu. I can rave about this drink all day, I appreciate the time they take to really craft your drink
-They have a lot of seating so you can get some work done 

What I don't like
-The lids of the cup are extremely hard to cap for some reason. Every time I get a drink and put the lid on, It always falls off, like it pops off easily. So before you put the lid make sure it's on all the way or else you'll get a nice brown coffee stain on your work clothes
-The coffee is a bit on the pricey side but that's expected from philz

Overall, I will continue to keep going to philz, so long as im in the area!
author: Shelly N.

description: If you want AMAZING coffee? You need to try philz! It is the best cup of coffee I have ever had in my life. Great quality, fresh, custom drip coffee. All of the baristas Are amazing as well. This place is a treat!
author: Thomas V.

description:
Spacious, roomy, full of light, you'd think the detail and ambiance was done by a fancy designer.  But no, it's Philz and it's the best of product quality and a place you can feel at home.  Patrons are frequent but not overwhelming.  You can actually think or work with wifi.  The Philz baristas here are much more welcoming and diverse.  I sometimes wonder if I'm back home in the Midwest.  Thank YOU Philz.

- Update, downgrading one star, between screaming children and obnoxious staff meetings, this Philz is not always the perfect locale.
author: Eric J.

description: That was godly amazing coffee. Albeit a bit pricey (3$ for small) this is a coffee experience that is on a whole  different level. There is a list of coffee varieties to choose from; I tried the tesora blend as recommended by my friend. It was a medium blend and the problem with some medium blends is that they taste watered down, but this one was packed with coffee goodness. If you request cream, your barista adds cream in for you but you can also opt for milk. I would rate their coffee as comparable to coffee served in any European cafe I've been to.
author: Jocelyn L.

description: New location :) Definitely not as busy as the store on 24th and Folsom. Coffee is just as good.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Don't get it wrong, I love Philz, but this location definitely ripped me from the large Mint Mojito I ordered. it was literally full of ice and barley any coffee. I was quite disappointing and probably won't come to this location again.
author: Adam J.

description: What lovely service all Passerbyer's received today:) we are so excited that Philz is opening across from our fav local children's park. Philz makes gorgeous coffee that beats Blue Bottle any day :)
author: SF U.

description:
Philz is the victim of not knowing where it really falls.  The coffee isn't bad.  I go there sometimes, but "Meh I've experienced better sums it up nicely."

Philz charges $4 for a cup of individually prepared pour over coffee.  That means they charge as much as blue bottle, four barrell, Grind.*  The coffee is not elite level coffee.  Sure, its better than the drip garbage from Starbucks or Peets!  Of course!  But its really nothing that special.  I strongly prefer the uniqueness of single origins over all the sorta boring blends that philz does.

Any time you order coffee, they make it for you then say "and try it to make sure it's perfect," and if something is wrong, they will happily fix it.  However, I HATE that phrase.  Implying that philz coffee will ever be perfect is a vast misunderstanding of the best case scenario for okay coffee.  

*The Grind is my coffee shop in San Carlos that is significantly better than Philz.
author: Chris A.

description:
Worse Jamaican Blue Mlountain coffee!  I guess I should of taken the employees advice and douse my coffee with their mystery cream and sugar.  Would of tasted better.  BTW, this is my second post for sure  My other review got "taken" down??:)
Keep up the good job!
author: Demanding T.

description: Perfect. I had the medium roast tesora prepared philz way. Im in no way an expert but I am a regular person who enjoys au lait, expreso, and turkish coffee. I really enjoyed what I got here. Tasted fresh and not burnt. Staff was incredibly friendly and offered to help me decide. :-)
author: Adrian A.

description:
Heard of Philz coffee, but never went since there are plenty of coffee shops in my neighborhood. My first visit....Wow! It lives up to its reputation. I made the mistake of ordering a latte when I first went, but the barista was nice of enough to help me pick out the right drink.

1) Coffee is great...i usually get the Tesora
2) Friendly baristas
3) I always find a spot to sit and use their Wifi
author: Jonathan M.

description: Done...well worth the walk up the hill to escape a sea of mediocre coffees down in central Noe.
author: David S.

description: I have spent a ton of money here in the past year and I do not regret it. This coffee can not be matched. No sugar needed. The sweet and buttery beans are unbelievable. There is no comparison.
author: Stephen D.

description: Excellent individually made coffee drinks - The Philz tradition is alive and well here.   finally tried the mint mojito and it's as good as everyone says it is.
author: Dave T.

description: Love the coffee!  The staff are so friendly; making each cup of coffee to everyone's personal preference. Young Asian lad has been making my coffee since they opened  earlier this year; and he's my favorite!  I love the fact that they have treats for kids and K-9 kids...after all they are located across the street from a playground and dog park!
author: Lucky L.

description:
One cup at a time. What a great mantra for coffee. As one who believes in taking things one day at a time, I can really appreciate the philosophy behind every cup.

I wasn't expecting much - originally, I thought, how much better can coffee really get?

I am a full believer in Philz Coffee. Their coffee is truly phenomenal, mindful bean selection, low acidity, personalized orders, fabulous costumer service. My first Philz experience was at the original Philz, and I LOVED that atmosphere of the place, down-to-earth, slightly worn, awesome music selection - just an overall good vibe.

I love iced coffee, so everything I've had has been iced. the Ecstatic Iced Coffee, the AWESOME Mint Mojito Coffee (Coffee and mint, two of my favorite things?! How had no one thought of that before?!), Mocha Tesora, Ambrosia Coffee of God - EVERY CUP has been just as great as the last.

I'm looking forward to my next Philz experience.
author: Emmeline A.

description: I first discovered Philz at Outside Lands in 2010 and have been hooked ever since! All the locations have a different vibe, but the baristas are all super quick and friendly. I strongly recommend Jacobs wonderbar or the philharmonic. Order ahead if you're in a rush.
author: Megan P.

description: This place is great. The staff was friendly and knowledgable. On the recommendation of my fellow yelpers I tried the mint mojito iced coffee. I was hesitant about trying but it was fantastic. My only complaint is that it is a relatively small place and was very crowded.
author: Traci B.

description: If I had to describe the Mint Mojito in a sentence in would be 'hand-crafted orgasm on ice'. It's only a touch more expensive than Starbucks. Yet, everything I've sampled has been infinitely more delicious. I don't mean to sound cliché, but I'll be back!
author: David R.

description: Friendly Service - Nice Menu - a bit pricey but different feel & nice atmosphere.  Ordered an Istanbul Cream Tea with Mint Leaves! Their menu was quite extensive & their coffee's looked really lovely. I'd like to try them sometime. What I liked about Philz Coffee was how happy every customer seemed with their Drinks. Everyone seemed pleasantly surprised and left with a bit of spark in their eye which a nice change of pace from the likes of Starbucks & Peet's. Philz seems more like a place you want to have coffee and sit down with someone and have a nice conversation or read a book or do some writing. It feels more about taking time out to enjoy every sip and not rush in and out. Their pastries are self serve and in a case of their own which was great too! I love that they have fresh mints and herbs and ingredients and I can't wait to try more beverages from their menu!
author: Julian I.

description: First time trying that mint mojito-- not bad!! Although it doesn't beat macchiato it does win points for its unique flavor.
author: Jolene L.

description: I really like this Philz. This is the 3rd one I've been to in SF. I've been to the one in the Castro and the one on Berry Street. This one is kind of tucked away in Noe Valley. Parking is a huge thing for me and parking around here wasn't difficult. Very easy to find parking and I thought it was nice that there was a park across the street. I didn't have a difficult time finding a seat to do some work at, but it can get busy it looks like. However, this one has more tables then the one on Berry, which has more couches and compared to the one on Castro, this one is much larger as the one on Castro only has maybe 3 indoor tables? Anyways, if you do decide to do work there I would bring headphones at least because it can kind of get out due to the fact that everyone loves this place. There are a few outlets, but it's not a ton. Staff is very nice and very quick. I think I found my new go to work cafe here!
author: Julie L.

description: wish it was spacious cause people looked so crammed. got myself a mint mojito but it was a bit watery (???) the philz downtown on front st is better in my honest opinion
author: Laurie M.

description: You'll always get a great cup of coffee at Philz. The original, homespun pour-over establishment in the city, this is a strong cuppa...Without the attitude you'll find at some other trendy coffee shops. A personal favorite is the turkish, brewed dark and finished with industrial cream and a mint leaf. Heaven in a cup. Try one of the many other brews too, and take home the beans if you love them as much as I do.
author: Mark N.

description: I go to Philz everyday and always to a new one, I have to say this is by far my favorite. The people who work here are so happy and friendly and super speedy. They were very attentive and of course my coffee was perfect. I highly recommend the ecstatic iced coffee and ask for it Philz way . If you want something hot the silken splendor was top notch . I will never ever ever go to star bucks again. The prices are a little high here but  there is no doubt that you are getting exactly what you are paying for!
author: Arren G.

description:
Yummmmaaaaay. So good! I had this coffee a week ago, and I've been thinking about it every day. 

I had regular coffee with cream. It was $3, which is pricey for a cup of coffee, but this didn't taste like a regular cup of joe -- it was really a treat. The barista adds cream for you, and they know the perfect cream-to-coffee ratio. If I had $3 to spend on coffee every day, I would be a regular customer at Philz. 

This location is also really cute. There's also a Philz in the Mission, but I love the feel of Noe Valley in the morning. There's a nice little park across the street, too, where you can stroll around with your coffee!
author: Ellie M.

description: Philz has some amazing coffee. They have about 20 or so different roasts to choose from! All their coffee is made to order and hand dripped. Some roasts to note are the Tesora and the Philtered Soul. But everything is pretty good here. And don't forget to try their iced coffees. You can also order whole beans to take home with you. If I could, I would have the Jamaican Blue Mountain everyday! Thank you Philz for helping me start my day right each morning!
author: Frances V.

description: Get the mint mojito even if it takes a long time. So far I found it to be the best coffee drink in SF.
author: Xteethx B.

description:
it's hard to get a bad cup of coffee here, i was studying for a major test for school and came here every week to try all the other flavors i've never tried. none of the ones i tried disappoint  me but continue to amaze me with the depth flavor and complexity of the after taste.

this specific location is also great because it's fairly new and in the periphery of noe valley and it's not as crowded as the other ones around the city. a good place to study/catch up w/ work/surf the web just because!
author: Joyce C.

description: Coffee is great, but playground for the kids next door makes the whole experience a family outing. If it is raining, there is a small kids section in Philz
author: Ryan K.

description: After trying the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee, Philz officially became my favorite coffee spot. The Mocha Tesora wasn't bad either! I also like this location more than the one in the Mission-- more parking, less people!
author: Stephanie G.

description: First time at Philz and I had the Mint Mojito Iced Coffee. It was so tasty, well prepared and presented. The mint leaf on top made it look nice and it tasted just like the description! The coffee was just what I hoped it would be. The staff was pretty friendly and they were pretty busy! Which is definitely a good thing because it must be good if they have a line almost out the door. This beats Starbucks for me any day of the week! Wish there was one in my town but since there isn't I will certainly go back when I am in San Francisco!
author: Elisa R.

description: TWO WORDS: Mint Mojito.  OMG so good.  i tried to make that at home, but its not the same.  If you go, you must order that.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Had to go here two days in a row on my vacation. So delicious! I love the number of flavors you can choose from, the availability of their descriptions, and the sweet and knowledgable staff. Asked for a substitution on a specialty coffee the first day and the woman who helped me said it was no problem and even told me how to ask for it if I came again. I had the ginger snap coffee hot and the next day I got the philharmonic with cream and honey. I am totally disappointed to go home back to boring ol' Starbucks :(
author: Ashley H.

description: Great local beanery and coffee shop. I had an iced latte and a scone. Both good and I'd return. Better quality than the chains. I like the individual drip and the recommendations of the staff
author: Rich G.

description:
So a lot of my friends are coffee snobs and turn their noses up at Philz, but I'm an unashamed fan and always recommend it. I usually go for a small Tesora and its always good.

I never sit in though, it's not pretentious which is a plus, but its scruffy, kids toys all about the place (I know its Noe), its got a weird waiting room vibe though. Could do with an interior refit, sort out the weird line system and stop asking me to 'taste it to make sure its perfect'. That gets old quick.
author: Alex B.

description: Never tasted coffee so creamy and foamy in my life, even just for a regular coffee!  Best coffee ever, but at a premium cost!
author: Chi T.

description: What you expect from Philz in a quite part of Noe. They play great music there.
author: Will D.

description: Quaint little Philz in a non busy area across from a neighborhood park and housing. This Philz is quieter than others and easier parking than the one located by the ballpark. The quality of coffee & friendliness of staff is great and up there with other Philz locations.
author: Emily C.

description: Even the best coffee in town can be ruined by a hipster moron behind the counter with a beard wearing a beanie and hoodie on a 95-degree afternoon - who wants to power trip and try to lecture me on where the line starts, after I've been neglected for far too long to begin with - (while standing essentially where the line, if there were one, would officially start) for no good reason (it wasn't even remotely busy and there was no one even behind me for this initial prolonged period of neglect)... meanwhile like 10 new employees are getting trained, and the few customers there are getting served at a rate comparable to the ratio of this hipster moron's IQ to the temperature inside his beanie.  Bottom line:  While Philz product speaks for itself, the bad taste left in my mouth from this visit offset all other flavors - and left me with no other choice but to officially ban this location.
author: Christopher C.

description:
thank you for an uncrowded philz.
i typically pick from tesora, ambrosia, ecstasy, mint mojito, etc.
this month they had "anesthesia"
still can't go wrong with philz, though I think I've settled on the best cup among the many awesome sf choices as sightglass.
author: Rob C.

description: This is pretty much home. Not only do I dearly love the baristas that work here but I've grown to adore the patrons of the store as well. There are definitely days when the place is loud/packed and the internet can be spotty but despite those minor infrequent events, this is a paradise. There is lots of space to work, free wifi, and dedicated staff that ensure every ounce of coffee you bring to your lips is made to your specifications. It would be awesome if they had more food options here (salads or bowls or sandwiches) but this is really one of the most enjoyable coffee experiences you could ask for in San Francisco.
author: Lily C.

description: Mmmmmmm. Great coffee & customer service- they helped me choose what to get based on how I prefer my coffee, and had me sip it before I paid to make sure I liked it. And I did- the coffee was great with a perfect amount of cream and sugar. Overall, a fun spot with great service and drinks!
author: Carolyn G.

description: Philz makes me pheeel good!  LOL  In all seriousness I love me some Philz coffee!  Will travel for a cup and I LOVE the Noe Valley location - it's on a quiet little corner and parking is pretty easy.
author: Samantha M.

description: I always enjoy the Mint Mojito.  The tables here are sticky.
author: Byron L.

description: They only do coffee!! Incredible coffee! Not gonna lie but I have def drank the kool-aid for this place. This place only does coffee - nothing else....so you can not buy that skinny mocochino with extra foam here...you can only buy coffee!!! And the best part - you buy coffee the way you like it - want it creamy and sweet, they can do it, want it straight up, they can do it, want it half and half, they can do it. Expert level at Philz is trying every single coffee! Go get some!
author: Pablo P.

description: If you want to brighten your day, or just feel good about living in this fantastic city by the Bay, go to this particular Philz and meet the most wonderful & sweet coffee shop ladies on the planet. Went here today, got greeted with a fabulous smile & treated to an unsolicited free iced coffee - hint: Try the Iced Mint Mojito with fresh muddled mint & ask for it not *too* sweet - you'll be in heaven in a heartbeat!!!!
author: Leo C.

description: We've been waiting for this Philz to open ever since The Animal Company packed up and moved down the street and the Philz "coming soon" sign was posted in the windows. Very happy that they are finally open! So far customer service has been great ... Staff is friendly and helpful, and they have a few tables and a couch inside to lounge, plus the children's park is right across the street. I will be strolling my babe down here often for hot coffee drinks on the foggy summer days to come.
author: cynthia q.

description: What's the hype to this place that everyone and their mom talks about? First time trying Philz Coffee after months and months of my friends raving about it and I have to say it's delicious. I tried the mint mojito which was very potent...not sure if sugar or coffee..haha. The only reason why I gave it a 4 was because it tasted like mediocre coffee quality masked with tons of other flavors and sugar.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Great Philz quality and service, as usual.  I even got to meet Phil today!  

Cute, clean, not so crowded (yet) convenient location.  I hope Philz continues expanding west/south into other parts of SF.
author: Marina O.

description: They seriously have a thing for making freshly brewed coffee JUST the way you like it. And they've got all these fancy names for each one too. I couldn't make up my mind and the barista was kind enough to offer her help and gave me some suggestions. That was nice of her and I loved how they asked how I wanted it. I'll definitely be going back!
author: Sharon G.

description: new store on 24th st..excellent Turkish Coffee, super friendly staff. Loved that wasn't a loud, frenetic, hipster sh*tshow..sometimes it's nice to just sit and relax without all the cacophony. More couches/chairs would be nice.
author: Charlotte F.

description: Stands up the the hype. Enjoyed an excellent ginger iced coffee.
author: Sean S.

description: Philz is my go to place. This is how I start my morning or pick me up for my afternoon. They serve only coffee no lattes expresso or any of that. But there is no need in my opinion because Philz coffee isn't just any kind of coffee is the bees knees. There are so many choice and so many different kinds of favors. The ecstatic ice coffee or the Mint mojito are  my favorite. It is a bit pricey but I am still giving the 5 stars because this is one of those rare occasions where I do believe it is worth it. Also the staff are always very friendly, polite and yet personable. It is a full service place which threw me off at first but they have always done an excellent job of making my coffee just the way I like but they always ask you to make sure you try it before leaving in case  you'd like any adjustments. Makes me feel pampered! So what the heck I'll pay a little extra for my coffee and tip! At other coffee places I will order a large but Philz makes it strong and I usually only need a small. I am quit happy I only live a few blocks away. Also Philz is dog friendly and has a jar of free treats near the register which I love since I'm a dog walker!
author: Genevieve N.

description: Great for kids! There's a kid's corner here and a park right across the street. Good way to spend a lazy Sunday afternoon.
author: Joshua S.

description: Minus the fact that the coffee was the most expensive I have ever purchased and the service was a little standoffish and weird, we were very pleased with our order and the coffee was absolutely delicious. I don't know what they do to that stuff to make it taste that way, but it was so good. I loved the little mint leaf as an added touch. Whenever we're in town again, we'll be back.
author: Johnny B.

description: Just coffee no espresso. But this is coffee done really well. Awesome friendly local staff with great vibes. Dog friendly neighborhood. Love the Nutty Scottsman...only known at this location!
author: Drew N Chelsea R.

description: Not only does Philz have the best coffee I have ever tasted (and at reasonable prices), but the staff is incredibly friendly and cheerful. The happiness is bouncing off the walls. Philz always makes my day better. I am so glad they have joined the neighborhood.
author: Len M.

description:
Okay - 

heard about this place and gave it a try - first of all - the coffee is okay

and the place itself - its a confusing mess of an operation to order a coffee, pay for a coffee and then wait for a coffee and then pick it - as a business or experience model - you end up going to through four stages to get a coffee and no clear process to make this happen easily. Maybe it was a new location that it felt confusing but it doesn't seem to be well thought out of - you start out with the register but you don't go there

tables are set up for a restaurant and not a coffee shop, dark walls and the too easy living room set up at the front is just boring - move the plant out as well as that is the only place to wait for a coffee.

I might have over looked the bank teller lines, unmarked food and crazy process if the coffee was better but was not that good.
author: first l.

description: There's so many amazing coffee shops in the city, and like everyone else, I've long debated about which one is my favorite. The amount of joy I derive from getting a Philz coffee, even compared to Blue Bottle, Ritual and Four Barrel, is insurmountable and I think it's finally pulled ahead as my favorite! I just recently moved near this location and I couldn't be more excited to get my coffee fix here every morning. The staff are friendly, the lines are reasonable and the coffee is superb. Can't get any better than Philz!
author: Holli B.

description: Love Philz's coffee and Phil is a nice man. Welcome to Noe Valley!
author: Nancy M.

description: This place is amazing, that's all that needs to be said. Both noe valley and mission locations are great. Can't speak for the Castro yet though.
author: Zach M.

description: This is my go-to place for coffee when i actually have the time. It's definitely not a place you to go when you're in a rush. on the weekends, expect to wait 10-15 minutes in line and another 10 to pay and get your drink. finding parking can also be a hassle, but when I do get philz, i'm always happy.
author: Micki C.

description: Oh how I miss this place! Absolutely amazing coffee hands down! Every time I come visit, I make sure to drop by Philz, and I am always so satisfied. Please send me an ecstatic iced coffee please! :)
author: Nicole L.

description:
Very Good.
Philz is my go to coffee in the city. So many blends to chose from that you can't go wrong.  All the coffee Is made to order pour-over but it does not take long. They always have 2-4 people making coffee. Highly recommended.
author: Dan O.

description: I discovered this place just before I moved away - too bad for me. The coffee is strong and no nonsense! The atmosphere is busy and you should be ready to order fast, wait a few for a drink, and then mosey on. If you like strong coffee ask for an ecstatic.
author: Carolyn B.

description: Always been a fan. Love the Mission location. Love having my coffee next to the tatt'ed, pierced, cops, firemen, and moms with strollers. Very SF. Only complaint about the Noe Valley location is their formulaic music tracks. I guess Phil has decided we are all baby boomers so we want to hear baby boomer pop music. We are all baby boomers for the most part up here, but I could do without the crap pop everything I walk in. Phil, how about blues, jazz or classical? Peets seems to get it.
author: k m.

description: The best coffee we've had! The mocha and the arabica were terrific, the former best as it's not too sweet, but can be customised.
author: Ian F.

description: Philz coffee is by far my favorite coffee! Besides my dad's coffee. The service is great and friendly and have always been on spot when choosing which coffee I would enjoy most. The parking in this location is better than others. They have enough tables for those who come in to study and those who just come in for a chit chat with their friends over a cup of coffee. The only downside is that I wish it was a tad bit bigger and that parking was quick and easy, but this is SF.
author: Michelle T.

description: The perfect coffeeshop. Rob is a hero, the crew are amazing and friendly, and I find myself spending an almost inappropriate amount of time there (which probably is the best kind of endorsement I could give). Delicious coffee, great spot, awesome people, cool vibe, five stars.
author: Clint W.

description: Had the Mint Mojito the other day. It is so incredibly delicious! It's refreshing, creamy, and just the right amount of kick for a pick me up. The service was friendly, although one of the people working seemed a bit peeved because I didn't tell him that I wanted the same drink as the lady in front of me...Other then that, good coffee, good experience. Love Philz!
author: Rebecca T.

description: five stars for the coffee and the attractive male barista with glasses
author: T G.

description: oh yes. this is A reason i come to san fran. Philz coffee is trruly extraordinary and really puts an effort in to their trade. Every cup of joe is hand crafted and worth the visit so by all means its worth the pit stop.  Yum!
author: Natalie M.

description: I live 4 blocks away. Both a good and bad thing since Philz is always tempting me. I usually avoid it on my way to work; otherwise I'll be sucked into their coffee vortex. A Philz habit doesn't come cheap but at least you'll be well caffeinated!
author: Cynthia D.

description: Latest experience was a love/hate for me. I have been to this particular location twice and both times I've taken people who are new to Philz (honestly, I'm still new myself). Second time here, I took my friend from LA and the order of lines were confusing. My friend asked the baristas and I guess she was cool enough to be helped, but not me. I asked the cashier and the baristas to help me out, but the cashier didn't seem to care and the baristas were of no help (one of them just pointed to the cashier). I felt so dumb, but then, I felt really pissed off. I asked another barista, an angel by the name of Emily, and she helped me out and assured me that not all of their staff there were pretentious and profiling baristas. I mean, I am paying customer promoting their business to my friends and family, I don't think anyone deserves that kind of treatment. Emily saved my experience for me, but I'm not sure if I'll visit this particular location again. Too bad, I have a cousin that lives nearby and this location was convenient for us to patronize. But, Emily, if you are reading this, thank you for being kind to me. Your kind display of customer service was memorable and you definitely deserve some form of recognition from your employer.
author: Julie C.

description: best decaf I have ever had...ugh dont be surprised I just moved here..people are super friendly!  i ordered swisswater as i remember...
author: Shuting Z.

description: Excellent pick me up after a full morning of running around to do errands and only a lite breakfast.  Mint mojoto coffee and the oat fruit bar are delicious together when you don't want a full meal.  Lines are long but they move pretty quickly. They do need to check their supplier to see what the problem with the caps are.
author: Lauren C.

description: Philz is a good cafe, wherever you go; the individual pour is the best way to serve coffee and I've patronized the one in the Mission for years.  And the folks in the Noe Valley location are very nice and the the atmosphere comfy and inviting.  That being said; the takeaway review is that the place is 'more show than go'. It isn't the temple to great coffee it presents itself as.  I've tried this store twice, and both times the coffees were weak.  I let the barrista choose the blend for me, requesting the strongest flavor and explaining that I like espresso straight for instance.  Both times, I got a very mild cup of coffee.  I've also ordered coffee that I intended to put a little half-and-half into for other drinkers.  Philz's insists on putting that in for you; both times too much (though I specified that I didn't want much).  Why not just let the patrons put in their own?
author: Jaime A.

description: Great coffee spot for caffeine connesoirs. All coffees are hand mixed and made to order. As a result, it takes a few minutes to get your fix but it's so nice. I ordered the "So Good" light roast coffee on the recommendation of one of the friendly barristas. It lived up to its name! Will definitely come back!
author: christina b.

description: My friends and I have made it a tradition to go to Philz Coffee almost every morning now. Despite it being in a different district it is completely worth the drive. The staff is always friendly and you can tell they truly want their costumers to enjoy their coffee. This location rarely has a line but that may be due to my casual college mid day visiting hours. One downside is that if you are in a hurry, Philz is not the spot. They put a lot of effort into each cup so it does take a little bit for them to make your coffee, but it is worth it.
author: Lauren B.

description: My absolute favourite Philz location. I never seem to be rushed out, having amazing conversations with the barista. I don't quite remember his name but I got an Iced Silken Splendor and it was just absolutely amazing. My go to place when bringing friends who are visiting to the sheer love for food the natives have.
author: Andrew L.

description: Yes and Yes.  Just go and see for yourself.  Went to opening party yesterday and this place has it all.  The attention to detail and consistency makes this place a winner at any location.  Been going to Philz for ages now...I think I have tried every store from San Jose to Berkeley...they never fail to win my love.  Awesome coffee, amazing staff, and the perfect place for a cup of love.
author: jacob s.

description: Highly convenient for parents with books, puzzles, and playground across the street. My 3 year old asked to come here FROM the playground for snack and milk. And I just got a free iced coffee!
author: Neda R.

description: Went in on Saturday June 8th in the afternoon.  First time there and wasn't sure how it worked.  They were so nice and especially Rory who was patient and explained the whole thing and gave her recommendations and was just wonderful.  I highly recommend the Mojito Mint Iced Coffee.
author: J W.

description: I wandered into Philz for the first time at this location. Being a novice coffee drinker, I appreciated their friendly, non-pretentious attitude and willingness to give advice on a great cup. They were willing to customize it however I liked, asking what type of milk, how sweet, how hot even. Watch out - their coffee is STRONG. They also had complimentary dog treats and offered to bring my coffee curbside so I could wait outside with my anxious pooch. I'll be back!
author: Katie R.

description: Smooth coffee, great food and awesome staff.  They differentiate themselves from Starbucks and other speciality coffee houses.
author: Andrew P.
